Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: elbee52
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very good location and walking anywhere was no problem for us. We found that the lobby of the hotel was much better looking than the rooms. The rooms were old and tired looking and really need a good updating. That said, it was a fairly spacious room considering we were in Europe. The shower was the really strange thing. It was a very dark shower stall and I had to keep the shower door partially open so that I didn't feel like I was in a damp cell for solitary confinement!! The restaurant in the hotel had great coffee and pastries, which is what we always sought out for breakfast. In the restaurant in the morning we encountered the only smiling, friendly face in the hotel and that was our waiter. He greeted us with a big smile the first and only morning we walked in there and was so nice and pleasant the entire time we were in there. He was truly bright spot of our stay! The people at the front desk were very accommodating and helpful when asked, but they didn't seem to like their jobs very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RegisCuritiba
Reviews.Content: Best location on Madrid, central nearly metro, Puerta del Sol place, El Corte Ingles e FNAC e Gran Via. No taxi neded to principal tourist locations. Very nice hotel concierge rooms excelent all confort a good price.

Reviews.Title: “good location and the best stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: mhernan
Reviews.Content: been in Madrid at the same area many times, but this is the best hotel I've stayed! Staff was very helpful to provide all extra amenities they have to offet to their clients, even umbrellas! I made late-check out with no charge and they kept my luggage til my midnight flight. Spacious, more than their 4-star calification, good amenities, huge bathroom, clean was good, but not perfect (do not care about it, they will clean and make that place fit perfect for you) very good free high speed wifi service (what about that, Hotel Arosa!) and bed is just perfection to sleep: VERY nice place to stay, as a single room is much more than I expect I'd be back with my entire family, love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: HermosaSteve
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel Liabeny in Madrid in June of 2011 and plan to return to use Madrid as a jumping off point to any last minute Spain adventures I have in mind. The staff of the hotel were excellent and attentive, and had the help I needed, in English, when I needed it. The rooms are small but I have seen much smaller hotel roms than these. The room was very well laid out, cleaned well each day, and I wasn’t there to stay in my room. My room overlooked Plaza del Carmen and the big problem was that half the nights I was there someone drank too much and decided that at 2, 3 or 4 AM it was time to bellow at the top of their lungs whatever was on their mind. If you stay at Hotel Liabeny you should consider asking for one of the interior rooms, rooms that overlook a courtyard inside the hotel. What Pusenin from Oslo forgot to mention is that whenever I asked the hotel staff to fix something it was done with Spanish cheer and German precision. My safe freaked out and had to be broken into by the hotel staff and it was done within ten minutes, forms to sign, and life on vacation resumed. When I asked for a certain number of towels in the room they made sure they were in my room every day. But what stands out is the location, four minutes from the Plaza Del Sol evening crowd viewing spectacular and the Metro station. Each day I walked to my destination and either walked back home or caught the Metro. The trains do run on time. The gym is small but well equipped for any workout that involves dumbbells and cardio; there were four cardio machines and a large range of dumbbells. Just off the gym is an excellent sauna. Just call down to the front desk when you leave the room for your workout and they will turn on the sauna for your exclusive use. The sauna is large enough for six, and there is a very private bathroom with shower for you to use before returning to Madrid life. The breakfast buffet was good, though not great. It never changed, the eggs were always runny, but if one was willing to embrace cold cuts, fruit, runny eggs, cereal, breads and cheese for breakfast it was very good. The buffet included an abundant supply of meats, cheeses, pastries, cereal, tea or coffee, fresh fruit and more. I had it for a week and it was just fine. I think the hotel should try to add variety, whether different egg preparations or something. The hotel also gave the same exchange rate that as the best rate I found at the Santander/Salamander/something bank just around the corner. The bank required 30 minutes to wait through the lines to exchange funds, the friendly staff at the hotel took a minute for the same rate. I was originally booked into another hotel, but due to a reservation mix-up I was transferred to the Hotel Liabeny. I will return to this hotel. The hotel is also located a three minute walk from the best vegetarian restaurant I have ever eaten at and I was raised a vegetarian. That vegetarian restaurant is called Artemisia located at Tres Cruces 4, just off Plaza del Carmen, and while the staff is frosty and okay (the service is gruff, which happens when the tip is included in the price you pay for food, just sayin’), the food is amazing on a scale never seen in this world before Artemisia. These folks are great at what they do, which is preparing incredible vegetarians’ food. I recommend the Hotel Liabeny to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Liabeny......an oasis of calm!”
Reviews.Author: Smilinglady52
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at The Liabeny and could not be more pleased with our choice......made with the help of reviews on TA! This is a quiet and classy hotel right in the heart of bustling Madrid! Very close to Puerta Del Sol, 10 minutes walk to the Prado museum, moments from Gran Via with its amazing buildings.......so lovely! There are many bars and restaurants and cafes within minutes of the hotel and we never felt unsafe even late at night. The rooms at The Liabeny are very nice indeed, clean and large enough with ample storage space, a fridge, hairdryer in the bathroom......again, large enough and nicely done out! My only comment would be that the rooms were VERY warm......the AC wasn't switched on......Madrilenos do not find it warm enough in April!! :) The public areas of the hotel are gorgeous......loads of wood panelling and leather sofas and chairs! The bar was comfortable and nicely decorated too. All the staff we came across were polite and helpful in every way. We had a late flight home and it was no bother to have our bags looked after for several hours! All-in-all, a great stay and would highly recommend for a visit to Madrid :)

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: sreedevi_palit
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Madrid. Centrally located and within 5-10 minutes of walking disctance from the Palacio Real and Puerta del Sol. The metro is within walking distance and you can shop all you want. Staff extremely helpful, can speak in English. They even helped book us for a Flamenco show.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Burgerwars
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many places in Europe staying at reasonably priced hotels. This is one of the better ones. If you're not bothered by the front desk staff, which are mostly unhelpful (one staff member was very helpful) you should be satisfied with this hotel. The room was clean and relatively modern/large by European standards. WiFi is free. Just ask the front desk for a seven day logon code. Other reviews mentioned the street noise. Yes there is street noise, but the double pane window when shut blocks just about all of it out. I did travel during a cooler part of the year, so I'm unsure if this is possible during the summer months. I wouldn't bother with the 15 euro breakfast buffet, as there are plenty of shops and restaurants all around. The hotel is about as convenient as you can get for Madrid. It's right in the middle of pedestrian shopping with the Puerto del Sol subway station only a few minute walk away. In all, it is a very good choice for a first time visitor to Madrid (which I was).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Liabeny in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: brittmarie_rebro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay at, it is central, the staff is very friendly and helpful, they all speak English, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. All in all our absolute favourite hotel in Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: dmejias
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located to see all Madrid attractions on foot. Extremely close to the Sol metro and easily reach all Madrid attractions. Rooms are very clean and with enough space, bathrooms very clean as well. Free wifi in the room and the breakfast buffet is good. Restaurants and cafes around are very good and are a good option for an early breakfast at cheapwr prices than the hotel. Nightlife around Plaza del Sol is very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “OK Overall – Pros and Cons listed…To/From Airport Suggestion”
Reviews.Author: blackslon
Reviews.Content: PROS: - Near metro station called SOL, which is an easy few stop ride to Atocha RENFE Station to get tickets to AVE and Talgo speed trains (these trains go to Segovia, Toledo, Sevilla, etc). - Hotel is a 20 min walk to Prado Museum, which is near the Botanic Gardens, Naval Museum, and Thyssen Museum - Free WiFi but paid internet (so bring appropriate devices) - Rooms are cozy, bathrooms are neat CONS: - Very noisy outside (slept in earplugs for 3 nights) BUT it appears that most hotels in or close to center of Madrid are located in very noisy areas - Rooms were stuffy but staff told us that it “was not the AC season yet” so we had no air in the room and it was too loud outside to open the window (we stayed at the hotel in March/early April) - Cafeteria staff do not speak English. 10 € Breakfast is not worth it (very plain). There is a nearby Starbucks where you can get good sandwiches, coffee, and free WiFi (ask for password at the counter)! - Staff did not know where the gym was and when we finally found it the treadmill was out of order To/From Airport Suggestion: Taking a taxi from the airport to city center is costly and unnecessary (cabbies start the meter at € 2.50 and entire fair can cost you up to 30€). There is an Express Bus leaving from the airport - 2€ (yellow-stripe on it) that takes you from Barajas Airport to city center in about 20 min (bus stop is a few blocks away from Prado Museum). The stop is called Plaza Ciabelle. Get off there and take a cab to the hotel – taxi will cost approx. 3.50€. It’s fast and cheap. Or, we actually walked from Ciabelle to Liabeny Hotel, which is a 20 min walk simply following GranVia (main street) to Salud St (street where the hotel is).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AMLinVan
Reviews.Content: Two friends travelling together booked this hotel on the basis of its reviews. The location is outstanding - between Puerta del Sol and Gran Via and within walking distance of almost all the main sights. Our room was a good size, comfortable and well appointed and serviced. It was very quiet. The only issue we had was that the English speaking TV channels didn't always work. The front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful and we were able to store our bags until we left on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: acdourlein
Reviews.Content: Nice helpfull staff, good clean rooms, beds a bit hard. We asked for and got a quite room. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel , but went just around the corner of Puerta de Sol to Museo de Jamon (I didn't choose the name), and had a very good breakfast for just a few Euros. This is a business hotel , so in the weekend you have low rates.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Aglasis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for 5 nights + Location: 2 minutes walk from Plaza del sol and 2 minutes walk from Gran Via. + Nice and various breakfast + Enough place and tables for all people that want to have breakfast - no one had to wait + Clean and comfortable rooms (however, a little bit smaller than needed) + Nice bathroom - No bathrobes and slippers in the room - Air condiioner did not work - Room service staff are not good with English; so to take this option is a terrible quest for non-spanish speakers It takes about 50 minutes to get form the Airport (terminal T4) to the hotel by metro with 2 changes. Escalators are not everywhere (!), be awared that sometimes you have to come upstairs. Taxi from the Hotel to Airport (Terminal 1) costed about 28 euros. It takes 30 minutes to get there in the morning. Nevertheless, I definitely recommend this hotel as it is really better than other 4-star hotels with the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LeonZhu
Reviews.Content: We went to Spain for a vacation in March and stayed at this hotel for two nights when we were in Madrid. We really enjoyed the stay. This hotel is centrally located and incredibly convenient for everything we want to do. Yet it's on a side street so it's not noisy. The hotel staff is fantastic and extremely helpful and friendly. They recommend we try the tapas on Calle de Baja and it's one of the best tip we got. The room was clean and tidy, nothing we can complain. They do charge 10 euro for internet connection. For the price, this is one of the best deal in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “As Spaniards will say, hotel super guay”
Reviews.Author: JAL0331
Reviews.Content: The liabenys is a very "cool" / nice place to stay at Madrid (as Spaniards say, it was super "guay"). Great location (almost at Plaza del Sol in the geographical center of the city), excellent service, and very reasonable prices for a 4-star hotel. Defintely, I will stay there again when I return to Madrid. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Location+Service=Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ABSharma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for four nights. As other guests have said, the location is excellent, close to Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, close to Metro Stations, also close to many restaurants, bars, cafetarias and Spain's biggest departments store. The Conceirge services were great, very helpful in planning our days out exploring Madrid; also made sure we got on a taxi at 4 am to catch our flight. So thank you to everyone at Liabeny

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Older Hotel, Horrible Check-In Experience”
Reviews.Author: WiseAdventurer
Reviews.Content: Booked our hotel/flights via expedia and used TrpAdv to check before paying. Most of the reviews are pretty on. The hotel is in the perfect location. Location (the best part on the slight downhill): Right in the heart of Madrid. You probably could not find better. You can walk to everything. For those of you late 20's/30's you will love the proximity to the hip area Malasana. I will review a bunch of the places we checked out there. If you want to take day trips, the Puerta del Sol station is right under the square. So close! Check In/Service (Very Bad): Girl at the front desk was a little snippy and not at all helpful. She took our passports and told us the room number. We are a couple and booked non smoking. When we opened the door on the 4th floor - ash tray and two twin beds. It 'stunk' in both senses. ;). So we go back down, ask for the proper room and a 'bed'. I don't understand common sense mistakes like this in the hotel industry. She was not at all friendly nor apologetic. These are easy fixes and good hotels know its not good treatment and most people have been travelling for many many hours to get here! lol (like us). The bellmen are overly friendly when you arrive and insist on taking your luggage and likely make a living off the tips. I'm fully capable so dont like the forcefulness of that (no way out of having them do this). Mind you, they are nice so hey, c'est la vie. Also, you would think she would give us the wifi code at check in? We had to go down and ask as well. Perhaps other desk staff are better and we lucked out with BRUTAL. Rooms (eek): I guess its European standards, but it certainly did not seem 4 star. Very old and outdated. The carpet and furniture was a little icky. However, we lived with it as we spend our days exploring the city. The beds are hard, and you will likely need to ask for an extra pillow as they are weak. Service wise, they enter the room a lot to do the sheets, turndown the bed etc. So that was nice. Also somes with some toiletries. Note to girls out there: You will need your own conditioner. ;) Also, the noise others write about is true if you keep the window open. In March, it was too stuffy in the room (AC not on yet in hotel apparently) so we wanted it open. Here is where you hear the late night life of madrid. After two nights we got used to the noise. Window shut - very minimal, so hopefully for you summer guests its not an issue. Gym: did the job. Had water and decent equipment. No window. Also, the sauna they advertise has a sign 'let the staff know if you want to use it one hour before'. Makes sense, saves money, but meant we never tried it. Resto: Didn't try, can't comment. Likely MUCH better out there. Taxi: We paid about 16 Euro from the airport and about 28 going back. There was the extra charge going back for taxis and maybe he took us for a spin. That or the other terminal is farther. Either way just wanted to give you an idea of cost. Both times, no traffic except for a little downtown Madrid. Other: You can lend an electrical adaptor from the desk for a deposit. Wifi is free, but you have to enter an annoying code every time you connect. That resto near the hotel is NOT WORTH IT. The one everyone mentions in the reviews called Garbo. I had the veg lasagna and my BF the pizza. The lasagna was not even made with noodles, no idea what that was, and the pizza bland. Service ify. For the price not worth it. Also, they charge 10% extra on the terrace. Be adventures and keep going up the street into Malasana -- some AMAZING fun tapas places with WAY better prices. Summary: if the price is right for you, then the location is right. No bells/whistles but does the trick if you got this hotel on a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian-abroad53
Reviews.Content: When a five minute walk will take you to the Puerto del Sol, ten minutes to Plaza Mayor and just twenty minutes to the Prado and Reina Sofia, your hotel is the perfect location in Madrid. The Liabeny is tucked into a small side street that taxi drivers have to use GPS to find but is so near everything you came to Madrid to see that it is a hidden gem. Rooms were standard European-small but clean and in good condition. Hotel staff were pleasantand helpful - in fact, the first room we were shown was on the fifth floor and further from the street noise (as per my request thanks to other Trip Advisor reviewers!) but had a small window looking at a wall a couple of yards away, so we returned to the registration desk and asked if they had something with a bit of a view. They were very accommodating to find us a room looking out on the plaza - unfortunately on the second floor. That brings me to the only "downside" of the Hotel Liabeny - street noise. Spaniards stay up much later that we North Americans are used to and the disco that is a few buildings away from the hotel kept its doors open until three or four in the morning. We were torn between wanting to leave our beautiful big windows open for the fresh night air and being able to sleep through the sound of people standing right under our windows laughing and talking in the wee hours. My recommendation in booking at this hotel would be to very clearly request a room with a view of the plaza but on the highest floor. We spent approximately 120 CDN per night and felt that was a quite reasonable price for a hotel so near all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot11
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, just off Sol. Lovely old hotel, beautiful public rooms. Bedrooms beautifully clean and comfy beds. Friendly, helpful staff. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel - very good for a weekend city trip”
Reviews.Author: KarolD_PL_BE
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean hotel. Big and cozy room, but can be a bit loud due to the 24h passing tourists. It has a nice location - close to the most important sights. Very nice breakfast with some regional specialities (sausages, ham, cheese). Bad thing - travel to the airport by metro requires 45min ride, and at least two transfers. Still a very nice hotel experience. Good place to stay for the weekend city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location - very dependable.”
Reviews.Author: JimDel10
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here, and the experience was very good, just like the first time.The staff was very accomodating by giving us an early check in (9AM). Also, to make sure we were not bothered by street noise, we requested an "inside room". While there is absolutely no view, at least you are sure to get a good nights sleep. I didn't eat breakfast there, as there is a Starbucks less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Staff is helpful, rooms are clean, and as everybody else has said, the location is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- close to everything”
Reviews.Author: banff
Reviews.Content: Thank you, TripAdvisor! I picked this hotel from TA reviews and was pleased with my choice. The location takes this hotel from "average" to "very good" in my books -- walking distance to the Prado, the Thyssen, Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol, yet my room was very quiet, as I had requested. During both stays I had a single room, and they are certainly small, but quite adequate for one person. Beds are comfortable and linens are nice. I would call the staff efficient and courteous rather than friendly. They provided helpful information when asked, and did my 4:30 am wake-up call and 5 am taxi request without a hitch. And there are certainly lots of staff around. A typical day would see 5 - 6 staff in the lobby. The wifi works well, but you have to re-enter the long numerical username and password each time you return to your computer, and they don't automatically tell you the wifi numbers when you check in -- you need to ask for them. The restaurant and cafe atttached to the hotel are both pleasant: good food, good prices. I thought the breakfast buffet was excellent. Hot and cold selections, lots of fruit, eggs, sausages, pastries and breads.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, central but quiet and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clareminky
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Madrid stayed at the liabeny hotel and so pleased we picked this after searching through reviews. Location is extremely central, but just off a quiet street, stayed in a room at front and was still very quiet. Rooms very clean, breakfast 15 euros each very good selection and convenient. Went to a restaurant just across the street to the left called garbo's went 3 times over food was so good! Travelled from airport to hotel via metro but went back via airport bus shuttle would definitely recommend this as what alot easier. Had to change 2 times on metro and negotiate alot of escalators with suitcases however picked up yellow airport shuttle bus from cibeles and cost 2 euros each and took 25mins so easy!!! Just make sure you get some good directions from hotel before going to find it as its a bit of a maze trying to find any hotel. Overall very good 3 day stay at liabeny, would defintely recommend the hotel mainly due to the quiet, safe location and cleanliness of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at an affordable price in the heart of Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: j_coldham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel liabeny with 11 others as part of a stag trip to Madrid. The hotel was centrally located and a short walk(5 minutes max) from Sol underground station. The staff were serious but friendly, maybe quite serious as we were a stag party of 12 English guys and anticipated rowdy English, although we were well behaved! There's a late night pizza place at the end of the road(25 metres from the door) and a shed load of everything including bars, restaurants, shops all very close by! Quite often (4 days) we had a siesta preceding the heavy drinking session in the late afternoon and there was a really annoying tune played continuously by some local shop nearby but then I guess you have to expect that when you're in the heart of a massive busy city like Madrid! The room had a safe which was easy to use, a minibar, very comfy beds and nicely appointed rooms. The reason we stayed at the Liabeny was the feedback we saw on trip advisor and it was absolutely worth it in my opinion. It offers sensible rates for what is in effect a fairly classy hotel. The white leather sofas in the bar/lounge and the white and black striped carpets in the landings were a nice touch and amazingly clean considering they are sat and walked on so regularly! None of us took euro adapters for the phone chargers but reception lent us these, even when I didn't have the €5 deposit in cash to hand which I thought was nice of them! The porters were up all night to allow us entry through the main doors even at 9 in the morning! So definitely a thumbs up from me!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: AHarrow
Reviews.Content: As the room was very hot and the air conditioning is not switched on this time of year, we had to open the window. The hotel is in a fantastic location right in the heart of the City, which means it is very noisy with the window open. So you can either be too hot in a spacious, clean well equipped room or you can be up all night listening to the party goers outside. If you go in a hotter month, then I am sure they will have the air-con switched on, so it won't be an issue, but check before you go. Apart from that, a lovely 4 star hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel; we'd use it again”
Reviews.Author: Maurice95
Reviews.Content: We were here for 3 nights, after a long hop, bouncing from Denver--Frankfort--Prague--Madrid with no hotel until Madrid. Hotel was nice. Everything was clean and the desk staff was usually helpful. Our room was quiet. The Liabeny is nicely located close to public tranny to get to museums etc. Interesting square and neighborhood to walk. Be sure to go to the Corte Inglis department store nearby. Even if you don't buy anything it is an interesting visit but be sure to pick up the brochure or check a guide book that tells its history. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but I don't remember why. I think the buffet selection didn't look that good, or, if it was order from the menu, selection was limited and prices high. We had breakfast and supper at a nearby Cinco Jotas and both were excellent. There is more than one Cinco Jotas location but we only used the one near the hotel. By the way, the view from our room, 113, of flowers, vines, and distant mountains was painted entirely on the wall of an adjacent building. A nice hotel. We would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum for a couple of nights in August. It's in a great location. The Hotel itself is beautiful, quiet and understated. The staff is exceptionally good: charming, helpful and attentive. The room we stayed in was very good value for money, very clean and very comfortable. An excellent hotel in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Claire M
Reviews.Content: The Liabeny is centrally located and nicely appointed. The room was small by American standards and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was well stocked with toiletries and on the fancy side. The only issue was that the hotel sits at the Plaza del Carmen and our first floor room was incredibly noisy, like there were no walls, so ask for a room on the upper floors. The staff was attentive and helpful. Madrid was vibrant, friendly and accessible to us yanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location and quality.”
Reviews.Author: Miguel C
Reviews.Content: Near the Puerta del Sol, the center of Madrid, it´s very confortable, the people is very nice and helpfull, and it´s a really 4 star hotel. Totally recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Noise a serious issue”
Reviews.Author: Kurt12
Reviews.Content: I liked the Liabeny in every way but one: noise. Check-in was pleasant, the lobby was lovely, and the Liabeny had an old-fashioned elegance that was really appealing. My updated room was quite nice. In the evening, however, I heard what sounded like a man talking in my bathroom. It was someone in the next room, talking in a normal voice on their cell phone. I have never heard that much sound transfer between rooms in any hotel before. I wore my earplugs, but I still heard my neighbor cough in the night. I was lucky to have a generally quiet neighbor, but if you are next to anyone that makes noise (e.g., a couple talking to each other), you could be unhappy here. For those who don't notice noise, this is a lovely hotel that might suit you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, and location!”
Reviews.Author: homervins
Reviews.Content: The hotel check-in process was very smooth and the staff spoke English well! We had arrived around 11am but our room was ready. We used the Madrid metro system quite a bit and so it was very convenient to have the Gran Via Metro and Callao Metro stations within 3-4 mins walk. The hotel is also within a 5min walk of the Puerta del Sol and other attractions. It's also very close to El Corte Ingles (Spanish Supermarket Chain) so easy to stock up on supplies. Hotel room was always cleaned very well (we usually left a 2 euro tip daily during our 3 night stay). The bed in our room was comfortable with good quality linens. It also had a table and chair along with a small two seat couch. Only one elevator in the hotel but runs quite efficiently. Hotel is in a very safe area so didnt feel scared for our safety at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SurreyTraveller15
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet hotel in pedestrianised area a few steps from Puerto del Sol. Excellent location,walkable to all major sights and many restaurants. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Thom_L_189852
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at the hotel, 3 nights. Check in worked quickly, unfortunately I got a smoking room even if I had requested a non smoking room. Don't forget your code to the wireless internet! I got a nice room. Nice bar area. Had dinner at the restaurant, also a great value, but service stressed even with few guests and food not great. Recommend to eat somewhere else. Gym small. Concierge helpful, but not very easy to get in contact with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel is dated”
Reviews.Author: crystal h
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant experience at Hotel Liabeny. The location was great and there was plenty to do within walking distance - even the Puerta del Sol! The concierge were very helpful, although not entirely knowledgeable. At night, we could hear the cars on the street and people shouting but it comes with the location. Because the decor is a bit dated, the hotel felt less clean although I'm sure it was fine. If you're looking for a modern hotel, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Floresmeyer
Reviews.Content: Overall excellen service, rooms, service. Very well located, clean. This is my first time there and I hope I had known about it before. If you are driving, because it is in the small downtown streets, make sure that you have a detailed map of the surrounding area and the way the traffic goes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: terridny
Reviews.Content: The hotel, staff and service were great. Hotel is in the heart of Madrid - we could walk to all the sights - including the Prado and Reina Sofia. Extremely convenient location - plenty of shops nearby (2 huge Cortes Ingles) and many restaurants and quick food places. Hotel was very accomodating - we got there around 11 am and they let us check in early. We had a triple and the room size was quite comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Liabeny was in the heart of Madrid. 1 block from Via Gran, 2 blocks from Plaza del Sol, walking distance to the Prado Museum, Reina Sofia Museum, the Opera, Plaza Major, Plaza Santa Ana, and many other popular destination. There was a safe in the room, minibar, and clean room. The room was a bit small but typical of Europe. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. They had a nice bar and cafe as well. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a safe, clean room in a GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rifles66
Reviews.Content: The hotel, staff and service were excellent. Perfect location, center of the city, within walking distance to many many restraunts, bars, shopping, hop on, hop off tours, and museums. Room size was sufficient and very clean. Distance from the airport is 7.9 miles and by cab service for 20 euros. Would use the same hotel and recommend to others. This is a 4 star hotel as advertised. .

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: EmmaDurnford
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for 3-nights at Hotel Liabeny over the New Year, having booked well in advance for only €112 a night. We had not booked breakfast as we knew there are many cafes close by. We were allocated room 610 on the 6th floor - a non-smoking room which overlooked Calle de la Salud. The room was a good size and very comfortable with a large bed (excellent mattress and pillows) and free WiFi which was a reasonable speed and a good bathroom. One of my gripes is hot water and Hotel Liabeny has copious amounts at a good pressure. In addition the lighting has got to be some of the best I have come across with bedside lights that are actually good enough to read by and room and desk lighting next to a comfy chair. We were very comfortable during the day in the room. However, unfortunately, although I had requested a quiet room (based on previous reviews), at night it became very noisy. The double glazing is effective at keeping out the noise but the room becomes stuffy and so you have to decide whether to go for earplugs and fresh air or peace and stuffiness. We were visiting during New Year and so there was obviously a lot more noise but this is just something to be aware of. There are rooms on the other side of the corridor which I presume face onto an inner area so would be quieter. However, that said, the hotel is in an excellent location in central Madrid, only a few minutes walk to Puerta del Sol where everyone gathers to see the New Year in. Most places can be easily walked to and we arrived by metro from the airport which was considerably cheaper than a taxi and again only about 5-minute walk from Grand Via metro stop. Although we did not eat in the restaurant the menu looked very nice and for a hotel fairly reasonable priced. As an aside we had two particularly memorable meals - one evening meal at La Finca de Susana on Calle Ariaban 4, where we had eaten on our last visit over 3-years before. It looks classy but the prices are very reasonable (read cheap!). Although they do not take reservations, if they are busy just give your name to the chap on the door and he’ll give you an idea of time, have a wander to work up an appetite and return for a great meal a bit later. The fact that this place is still going strong since we last visited and is always full, is testament to the quality of food. Madrid is a city where everyone eats late so bear this in mind. Our other good meal was lunch on New Years Eve in one of the older tapas bars - La Casa del Abuelo on Calle Nunez de Arce, 5. Although our Spanish is not great (we do try really hard) the staff were very welcoming and helpful. The food is so good with generous tapas and racion portion sizes (try Pimientos Padron, gambas and the patatas bravas mista). All in all a very good stay and I would definitely stay at Hotel Liabeny again in the future, but will make sure we have an inner facing room for a peaceful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: rivertrader46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights on recent trip to Spain. The hotel is in an ideal location for visting the sights of Madrid and is only a few minutes walk from most places. Our room was very comfortable and located in side street so the noise at night was not too loud. The hotel breakfast was very good with a number of hot and cold selections. This hotel cetainly deserves its TA rating

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: kmathewsr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful trip to Spain (Madrid and Toledo) in September 2011. We stayed at Hotel Liabeny for all 8 nights of our trip, and found the hotel to be welcoming, comfortable, and phenomenally well-located near Puerta del Sol (historical significance; metro stop; many vendors and demonstrators) and Plaza Mayor (historical significance; many fine restaurants, vendors, and artists/musicians nearby). Additionally, while perhaps not culturally significant, El Cortes Ingles (an extremely large department store which even includes a grocery, travel agency, and wine shop) is only 1-2 blocks away from Hotel Liabeny. That was very handy for last-minute "necessities" like additional memory cards for our camera, more contact solution, and food supplies for our picnic at Retiro Park. Our room at Hotel Liabeny included daily breakfast, which my husband and I agreed was excellent, hands-down the very best that has ever been included in our European hotel rooms. Some books note that the Spanish diet does not emphasize fruits, and that these can be difficult to find while traveling. This was not our experience at Hotel Liabeny, however! Each day of our trip, my husband and I enjoyed a wide array of fruits, including pears and kiwi! We also enjoyed eggs, cereal, juices, and several types of meats. Delicious! Based on suggestions from travel books, I e-mailed the Hotel Liabeny staff a few weeks before leaving for Spain and requested a non-smoking room on a higher floor. The staff was very attentive, and accommodated this request without any trouble. One night, I did wake up to a little street noise, but I feel back asleep without much difficulty. This only happened once, however, and, in my opinion, was a small price to pay for the hotel's superb location. I would suggest that guests consider requesting a room on a higher floor, as it seems that this may have solved some of the street noise problems that others experienced. One side note, in September 2011, the church across from the hotel was being repaired, and was in a state of construction-related disarray. There were a few homeless people who slept with their dogs next to the church each night. They never bothered my husband or me, but their constant presence and the relatively unsecured state of the church did concern me a little. I would imagine, however, that this will be less of a problem once the church restoration process is complete. For all I know, this may have already happened. My husband and I adored Madrid, and cannot wait to return some day! Of the major European cities we have visited, Madrid is, by far, our favorite. We would highly recommend a trip to Madrid and a stay at Hotel Liabeny.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: filisann
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas day, the whole city was decorated with lights. The staff was very friendly and pointed us to the nearby plazas in the area. The rooms were very comfortable. Nice bathrooms. So many hotels these days all look alike with the similar bedding and sleek, impersonal furniture and those little useless covers on the foot of the bed, but this room had a lot of character if even a bit dated. The breakfast was really good. There are many restaurants in the area. It is also close to a hop on hop off bus, that is a lot of fun and worth doing if you have little time.

Reviews.Title: “holidays in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NIK021978
Reviews.Content: Good location, near to everything.Very good breakfast and tasty. Clean but not for 4stars hotel. The staff very friendly but difficult to comunicate if you don't speak spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tiel
Reviews.Content: We didn't know Madrid when we booked and were delighted to find the location of the hotel was walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Plus although it was in a busy area it is on a quiet street so doesn't get the noise. Rooms were very nice and well serviced. We arrived early and were given access to the rooms. We booked a great rate through Expedia and were given the rooms right above the entrance to the hotel. Rooms were just fine but it was a little noisy with the main hotel doors opening frequently and late arrivals making noise. I would stay here again but ask for a different location. Make sure you check out the nearby food markets in the evening as you can have a great dinner just wandering around the market and buying small serves of various foods. easy walk to palace and Prada museum. We loved Madrid and would stay at the liabeny again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: FFadden
Reviews.Content: A very good location. Close to metro in the walking streets area. It is also approximate half way between the Prado and Royal Palace; about 15 minute walks. The Hotel is a down to earth 4star; with restaurant, cafe and bar that suit a wide range of travelers; business trips, families, couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Kazgraz
Reviews.Content: We didn't know much about Madrid when booking this hotel, so it was a nice surprise to find ourselves smack bang in the middle of one of the busiest shopping areas I've ever seen (think Times Square). The hotel is in walking distance of most of the main sights, and within 5 minutes of about 3 different tube stops. We reached it from the airport via the tube, 3 trains in total and a 5min walk - if you plan it beforehand the tubes are easy to navigate and it took about an hour from leaving the airport to getting in to our hotel room. The hotel itself has an impressive lobby and generous rooms, nicely presented with a humongous double bed. The only thing missing was tea & coffee facilities in the room, but you can walk out of the hotel door and find somewhere for coffee within minutes. We drew the short straw with room location and ended up on the first floor overlooking the front of the hotel, and this is the only drawback of such a central location. Madrid is a lively town and we were woken up each night by party-people who were out as late as 5am sometimes. It wasn't so noisy that we couldn't sleep, but noisy enough that it wouldn't be suitable for a family with children. However, I don't think you could find anywhere quiet if you were staying in this area, and as a base this hotel was comfortable and convenient. The only reason this review doesn't give 5 stars is the slightly cold nature of the staff. Only one member of staff ever gave us a warm smile or a greeting as we went by, the rest ignoring us. Granted, we were ignorant British folk with very minimal Spanish, but the lack of approach- ability of the staff meant we did not feel comfortable enough to ask for advice on good restaurants / places to visit etc. Not a necessity, but meant our impression of the hotel was "nice" rather than "amazing". We got a great deal on Expedia though, so in terms of price this was a smashing bargain for a 3-night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Pris11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was locatedwithin walking distance of most attractions and the metro. Our rooms were ready way before the usual check-in time, and after an overnight intercontinental flight that was great. The staff very helpful, the breakfast buffet very complete. The rooms were clean and the amenities good enough. Inside rooms are better if you are a light sleeper, there is some noise coming from the street if you have a window. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: amelen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an amazing location right off the main streets that branch off from Puerta del Sol. The subway (puerta del sol stop) was a 3min walk away. Even though it was on the main streets, the hotel was very quite. The services was almost impeccable - they even had a toothbrush for me when I realized I left mine at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: CaroServigna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during November. The location is great as it is a couple of blocks away from Puerta del Sol, Gran Via, Plaza Mayor and Plaza Cibeles. There is a big department store called El Corte Ingles just two blocks from the hotel where you can buy water, have breakfast and get pretty much what you need to snack or eat. There are also many restaurants and cafes around. Both bedroom and bathroom are big, but the bed is on the hard side. When we arrived, there had been some electrical work done in the bathroom, and there was dust and debris on the floor that was cleaned the day after. They offer free wi-fi in the bedroom. The problem was that since we went in November, the AC was off. We were instructed to open the window if the room was warm, but since the hotel is located in such a popular area, it was too noisy outside. It was almost impossible to sleep. When we closed the window it was too hot. Therefore, we didn't get a good night sleep when we were there. I would recommend this hotel if you go on a season where they turn on the air conditioning. If not, the hotel really doesn't accomplish its function of providing a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: ABCHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located between the Gran Via and Plaza del Sol. We took a taxi from the airport which cost around 28 euros. The lobby of the hotel is spacious and the reception staff were efficient & concierge took our bags to the room. Our room was 330 and was a twin. The room was pleasant and spacious. The bathroom was a little bit on the tired side, but was adequate. Breakfast wasn't included, but there are plenty of cafes nearby. The hotel is within walking distance of lots of Madrid and metro stations although we didn't need to take any ourselves. This is a very good value hotel and I would stay here again & recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: married35
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Madrid and we really wanted to use their transportation system. We used the Cercanias train (with the senior discount of 40% we got at the airport station) to the SOL station. (It did mean a transfer, but that went smooth). The walk from the SOL station was just about 5 minutes. We saved vs taking a taxi. The Hotel is first class. The breakfast is superb and is worth the charge. They gave great recommendations for Flamengo dance show (just 2 minutes walk) and tapas. The room and bath were satisfactory. For a small charge you can use the tv as a computer if you didn't bring one. We walked everywhere El Rastro market on Sunday, the Royal Palace, the Prada and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Didn't know what to expect for 100 euros (off season), but when we walked into this elegantly appointed lobby, which reminded me of the 1930s, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was fantastic and perfectly located. Just enough off the Gran Via and Puerta del Sol to avoid the loud crowds, but close enough to be there in 2-3 minutes walk. There was also the added bonus of free hi speed internet everywhere and the reception and concierge were both very helpful. You can walk to 3 different metro lines/stations in 5 minutes so you can get anywhere in Madrid easily. Only negative; the bartender did not know how to make a White Russian. ;) Highly recommended otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, but great location”
Reviews.Author: MHL8488
Reviews.Content: spend your time in Madrid, not in your room and you won't be disappointed. This hotel has a wonderful staff and charming breakfast restaurant. I only stayed here one night, but the location was excellent. The only downside was that the AC was turned off (it was Nov), so my room was very hot. I opened the window, but could not get a cross breeze as my room faced the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsrandom
Reviews.Content: WOW - An excellent hotel, in an excellent location with excellent service- Loved it all. The room was nicely appointed, and bigger than a breadbox. The staff was more than willing to please you. The breakfast was first class. Hands down, this is where I will stay while visiting Madrid! The price was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Devs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a fantastic central location - literally two minutes walk either side to the Grand Sol or the Grand Via. The rooms were quite spacious with a large bathroom and comfy beds (pillows were a bit hard though!). Breakfast was not included with our stay but there was a trendy cafe within the hotel where you could buy something light to kick start the day or opt for the 15 euro breakfast in the dining room. Our room was on the side of the hotel where noise wasn't an issue. However, our friend's room was on the front which was subject to rowdy revellers (due to its proximity to local night club) until the early hours of the morning - so ensure you ask for a room located on the side or back of the hotel. We would definately recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Loey2
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Staff spoke good english and were most helpful. 10 minute walk from tourist attractions, museums, Ritaro Park, excellent Naval Museum, lovely squares with tapas bars and great restaurants. Short walk to Metro which is 2 stops from Renfe Atocha train station and easy to use. My trip to Andalucia is on blogger.com and picasa. Beds nice and hard, but pillows a bit hard if one is accustomed to down soft pillows. A bit brown and dark, not fancy but a comfortable, clean, quiet place after a long day of sightseeing. We prefer to take breakfast at the many nearby coffee shops with the locals. I prefer a light breakfast. One can take a bus from the airport to Celebes Circle near Ritaro park and it's a 10 minute walk or easy short cab ride from there. For history buffs take the metro to Hemingway's favorite place in Madrid's historic district for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for touring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: HoffersHawaii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic older model. Nice huge lobby with lots of couches and chairs. First room had a queen but was too small. We were immediately moved to a larger room with 2 twin beds. Beds are comfortable but pillows a little thin. Maid brought us extra pillows as soon as we asked. Breakfast buffet is pretty good, especially if included with room...otherwise it's 15e per person. Best thing about this hotel is location - one block from Grand Via and 2 blocks from Puerto de Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure”
Reviews.Author: Barbaque
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great public areas; wonderful staff; adjacent restaurant; great location (a few short blocks between Puerta Del Sol and Gran Via)/across from Plaza Carmen, and away from main street noise, with many restaurants and shops in the area; large room (by European standards); nightly turn-down service. Cons: Odor of either air freshener or detergent (can't pinpoint the exact smell), permeated the room, linens/towels. Because I am chemically sensitive, it was a little problematic, so had to keep the window open. I couldn't figure out if the grout around the shower was dirty, or if it was mold (I didn't want to look too closely), but the grout needed to be cleaned/replaced. Also, the water temp in the shower wasn't consistent. So when I adjusted the temp to my liking, a blast of hot water would spout out for a second, and then the temp would drop back to normal. I had to be cautious about getting burned. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cigarette smell hotel”
Reviews.Author: zapoyol
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for a few days after coming from Barcelona. Positive: location, it is near puerta del sol and it gives you great access to many places in Madrid. Concierge ( Pedro was fantastic, Daniel was also helpful) were really helpful to give me info about the place. Pedro helped us to get a great sit at the Carboneras Flamenco tablao. Negative: We understood that we were staying in a non smoking floor or hotel.We could smell the cigarette odor in the carpet. We were waiting for an elevator and we noticed a strong smoke odor around. Sudenly a cleaning lady came out or a door that said: gym,bussiness in front of the elevator ( she spray something in the air to camuflage the odor). Beds are not comfortable and the pillows are hard, when I got home my back thanked me.

Reviews.Title: “The best to experience the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: johoro
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from four days staying at the Liabeny and I enjoyed it so much. It's located in the heart of Madrid, but is situated on its own private street, which makes it so peaceful. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is very good, and I would recommend this as the place to stay, if one wants to walk out the door and be close to shopping, within a healthy walk for the most important sites, and really wants to experience being in the heart of one of the most elegant cities in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: OlderMom60
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading many reviews on this sight. The hotel had our reservations in order. The location could not have been better for sightseeing. My husband and I love to walk and from this hotel it was an easy stroll to the Prado and other sights in Madrid. Plus it is convenient to two Metro stops, Sol and Gran Via. The buffet breakfast, which was extra, was worth the money. It was well rounded and had a large assortment. The room was fine, but a little small, but we slept well for the two nights we booked. The only drawback is the neighborhood to the left as you exit the main door. While no one bothered us, if you were looking for an "escort", that was the place to shop. On the right was the "malled off" shopping area for clothing and accessories.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: georgie040489
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Liabeny as a surprise for my boyfriend’s birthday. The hotel staff were fantastic from the moment I booked it. I sent balloons and banners to the hotel from the UK and they put them up ready for our arrival. The location cannot be faulted. You are in the centre of all the shops and very close to the metro. The metro is by far the best way to travel and very easy to use (a lot easier than London). We booked tickets to watch Real Madrid and it was well worth the money! We also did the stadium tour another day which was also brilliant. We took a trip to Madrid Zoo which was a lovely day out. There is a wide variety of restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel. I would recommend following the life style of the Spanish as our first day there we woke early and also went out for tea early and there was not much happening. Getting up late and eating late is what you need to do. If you like walking you can walk for miles at night around the streets. The buildings are fantastic and well worth having a walk around to see all the historic statues. Back to the hotel... The buffet breakfast was lovely, so much choice. The rooms were brilliant and the rooms were cleaned every day and the beds made twice a day. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Clean Hotel with Outstanding Service in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RobR66
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Liabeny based on reviews from Tripadvisor and a recommendation from a travel guide book we read. We were traveling with a 2 yr old child which brings its own challenegs but the entire staff went out of their way to accommodate our every need. We had large room (by European standards) with 2 double beds and a small connecting salon with a pull out sofa bed which was perfect for 3 adults and our child. The room and bathrooms were very clean and comfortable. The concierge was extremely helpful in directing us around Madrid as needed including helping me find good places to run and ride my bicycle. The location is perfect a very short walk from the Puerta del Sol. Also convenient to Calle Gran Via and the Plaza Mayor is not far at all. The location allowed us to walk everywhere we wanted to go in Madrid from Museo del Prado on the East to the Palacio Real on the West. The attached cafe was actually very good as well. We didn't book the room with breakfast included but ended up eating at the cafe anyway. The food was very reasonably priced for Madrid, convenient, tasty, and even had healthy options. This hotel was absolutely perfect for the needs of a small family.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpfulness Spoiled It”
Reviews.Author: GBB_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews by the majority of people on this website however apart from the central location our experience was not a good one - so please beware. When we arrived the receptionist provided no welcome or normal courtesies. I asked if our requirements that we had requested prior to booking had been possible to provide, he said yes and just pointed to the lift. When we got into the room they hadn’t, it wasn’t the fact that they hadn’t - it was more annoying that we had been incorrectly informed. Although clean, the room was certainly not 4 star standard by a long way in my experience. Small, looking out onto a shaft with pipes and the bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. The cleaning staff then entered our room without evening knocking first (the button on the door to say ‘do not disturb’ doesn’t appear to function) so use the sign if you don’t want caught in an embarrassing situation. For one morning we wanted a wake up call, when the receptionist decided to get up he just pointed to the concierge and informed us that it was his job. The concierge was talking to someone already so we waited, even in another language it was obvious that he was talking & laughing with a friend and just ignored us. After several minutes we gave up and left. On check out again a different receptionist wasn’t exactly helpful, just shoving the printed bill in front of me and the card/pin machine. She never asked how our stay was but by that point we just wanted to leave anyway so it was probably a good thing. I realise we could have complained at several stages, but given it was supposed to be a romantic break it would just have spoiled it even more & personally I never fancy my chances complaining when I don’t have a good comprehension of the language. I’ve spent the last 20 years of my life in all sorts of hotels all around the world, mostly without any issues & this is the first time I’ve ever felt the need to write a review like this. We left extremely disappointed given the high hopes we had based on the reviews – possibly we were just unlucky but I honestly doubt it given that it appears that multiple staff have a similar attitude. I realise our experience doesn’t correlate to the majority but please take this into consideration and explore other options.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricaUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at the Hotel Liabeny which is excellently located near to the Sol Square and Metro station. Many Madrid sites are within walking distance, and its ideally located if you want to be at the heart of this lovely and vibrant city. There are so many restaurants, bars, shops around you are really spolit for choice in the immediate area. The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful offering tips on directions etc, and were also accommodating in allowing us to check in early. Only reservation would be that the bathroom looked like it could be in needs of updating, but apart from that, everything was clean and furnished accordlingly to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CharleyWood
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel - it was great, Right near the city centre, within walking distance for all the shops, cafes, resturants and night life that you could ever want. The rooms are really spacious - I had a sinlr room and it was perfect just for one. The toilet was a good size with a fanastice shower that was so powerful it nearly blew me in to the wall (I love that when it happen!). The rooms are very clean. The reception and concierge were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “All good”
Reviews.Author: dermagen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay in this hotel. Have to say it was very enjoyable. Madrid is a fabulous city, this hotel is right in the heart of it, great room, great service and excellent location, within walking distance of most tourist sites. Staff were helpful & courteous. Didnt eat here but there are several very good restaurants nearby. Would recommend it to anyone on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pusenin
Reviews.Content: There are 2 positive things to say about this hotel - location and free wi-fi. My room, although a single room, is the smallest I have ever seen. I can live with that but the worse part was that it reeked of old dust. It is clear that both carpet and curtains are in a desperate need of proper cleaning. Walls are paper thin, I could hear everything that went on in the corridor and in the rooms on the side and above. In addition the lift engine kept me awake most of the night, even with earplugs. Again, this is not a 4 star propery, I changed to a 3 star close by which is much better.Location is great though, walking distance to everything and a few minutes from Gran Via and Sol, but there are way better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “excellent breakfast, great location”
Reviews.Author: lcprieto
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent breakfast. Try to get a package that includes it, it's worth it. Very nice rooms and very confortable beds. nice comon areas nice service excellent location Cons: Very poor gym we could hear a bit of noice coming from the street on the Saturday night. Overall very nice hotel. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: coffeepot11
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here - perfect location, spotlessly clean, nice room, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, in an Excllent Location”
Reviews.Author: Shug402
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Liabeny couldn’t be better located. It’s tucked around the corner from the main street, but with easy access to everything that you would want in Madrid. The public areas are smart, and the rooms are adequate, particularly since we were only staying for one night. However, my main recommendation is based on the helpfulness of the staff, the Concierge desk in particular. Both ourselves and our friends who were travelling with us, had lost out luggage on the flight to Madrid, and the Concierge was untiring in his efforts to locate it, which he successfully did, and managed to stop it being delivered to the hotel, two hours’ drive away, that we had just left! That effort alone is worth five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: malcb37
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, so central. Quiet room, good aircon, comfy bed and room safe. what more can you ask for Puerta del sol only 200 yards away, but hotel up side street so no noise. Been to madrid quite a few times now, prices are going up for drink- beer especially.

Reviews.Title: “we'll definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: twohungrytravelers
Reviews.Content: It was all I expected...Walking distance to all major attractions. the room is european standard..which is small..but nice. We did not stay in the room too much anyways..people do not sleep in Madrid. This hotel is a few steps away from Plaza del Sol...and 5-10minutes walk to Mercado de San Miguel..if you're a foodie..this place should be on your top list when in Madrid. About a block away from the Mercado is the famous Botin Restaurant. Back to the hotel..this hotel is in the CENTER of everything. As soon as you step out of the lobby..to your right is the closesr way to Plaza del Sol and to your left are a whole bunch of restaurants, and shops also. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, clean and spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: Shaleeny83
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room at Hotel Liabeny, it had 2 single beds and a pull out sofa bed. I was the one sleeping on this sofa bed and it was ok but I was told the beds were very comfortable! The room itself was spacious but we were on the 2nd floor facing backwards towards other rooms so it was quite dark, didn't really get any sunlight.. but we weren't too bothered as didn't spend much time in the room. The bathroom was a good size with a powerful and hot shower, and it was always cleaned daily to a high standard. We didn't pay for the hotel breakfast but there is a cafe attached to the hotel where the staff were always smiling and the crossaints always fresh! The biggest bonus of this place was the location! Plaza del Sol was literally a 3-4 minute walk away and it felt safe walking back from the metro (again, not far at all) late at night, always people around... even though the location was central, it wasn't noisy at all and slept soundly every night! Overall, I'd recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent four star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: esteban95
Reviews.Content: We stayed on July 2011 in this great 4 star hotel. Superb situation, near Puerta del Sol, Plaza Mayor, etc. , and full of restaurants, shops ( two Corte Inglés) . Silent hotel, free safe , perfect airco ( controls inside the room), and the triple room ( Eu 140.-includign breakfast, was adequate., it also had a entrance hall . Breakfast complete, and a good cheap restaurant. ( We paid 23 Eu per person, including wine, three coursel meal). Negative: the only complaint was that every night personnel opened the room door (asking wif w needed something or to open the third bed) but never nocked first to verify if we were inside. One night this happened at 10 p.m .Correct check in and check out. I strongly recomend this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mutigers42
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in the best location. By EVERYTHING. Make sure to get their breakfast included or at least pay for it in the morning if not because the buffet is amazing, best breakfast included in any hotel or hostel ive been to in my 32+ countries so far. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: gaytravel10
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent and very clean. Very well presented hotel. The hotel was ideally located in the centre of Madrid so easy access to shops, sites etc. Staff were friendly. Would recommend people to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasoncrh
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on bookings.com for this place, and after reading the reviews I decided to take it. Overall I was pleased. The hotel is smack in the middle of everything in Madrid- I was able to walk everywhere. The hotel itself is fine. While the decor is somewhat dated, it's all very clean. The bed was comfortable Good free wifi Internet service. And a great buffet breakfast. While some staff weren't too personable, that was okay. Also, the corridors got a bit noisy at night. Overall, though, i would recommend the hotel and wouldn't hesitate to stay here the next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed at in Madrid....”
Reviews.Author: jmartinez456
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. It is right next door to Our Lady of Mount Carmel Catholic Church, so if you like to attend Daily Mass you don't have to walk far. It is right near the Metro at Plaza Del Sol, so if you wish to take a trip to Toledo, Avila, El Escorial or anywhere else, it is extremely convenient. If you want a taxi instead of a metro, there is a taxi stand right outside the door. The best restaurants are nearby, including a delicious Italian eatery. The staff is wonderful, the rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is generous and the lobby is lovely. The concierge is helpful, aiding us with train ticket purchases. Even the background music is unique. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Can't praise it enough”
Reviews.Author: liatTelAviv
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Liabeny : the location was fantastic, close to everything, the breakfast was rich, plentiful and tasty, and the service was attentive and caring. We highly recommend it to anyone visiting Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eddy827
Reviews.Content: Check in was very fast, about 5 minutes, the rooms were nice and clean, may be a little bit old but it was fine for me. the service was great. In general it was a great hotel, close to Gran Via and Plaza del Sol, never used the subway, walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel very good location”
Reviews.Author: elnavermaak
Reviews.Content: This a a good hotel and the location is very good. It is right in the centre of Madrid, although you have no noise in the rooms.The staff is like a tourism office- they can help you quite good .

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Calif_traveler_11
Reviews.Content: On a quiet side street between the Gran Via and Plaza del Sol, the hotel manages to be in the center of things but still tranquil. The staff at the front desk is multi-lingual and very helpful. The room - which we book and paid for in advance to get an exceptional deal - was larger than rooms in some of the other hotels we booked in Spain. It was clean, well appointed with comfortable beds and very efficient air conditioning (a necessity given the hot summer days in Madrid.) There are so many good places to eat in Madrid - and within a few minutes walking distance from the hotel - that we didn't have a meal there, so I can't comment on that. However, breakfast, beyond croisant and tea, seemed overpriced. An early morning walk to the Prado, or the Royal Palace, is reasonable, very pleasant and shows just how close you are to many of the places you'd want to see. Aside from the Prado and Reina Sophia museums, I'd highly recommend a visit to the Thyssen-Bornemisza. After a day visiting the Old Masters at the Prado, the excellent collection of modern art in Thyssen is refreshing. The Madrid metro system is convenient and easy to navigate when you want to get farther afield. Buy a multi-pass ticket to save on those trips. As an aside to visitors, you will greatly enhance your visit by getting on 'Spanish time'. Stay out and eat late (9 or 10), have a light breakfast and eat again around 2. Enjoy walking in the evening. Enjoy the crowds of strollers, window shop and have a late latte. Go to bed at midnight or 1:00. Watch where the crowds are enjoying tapas and join in.

Reviews.Title: “Older Style, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: electro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very good value. It also had free w-fi. It's an older style hotel that looks like it has been recently renovated. Rooms very comfortable. Our rate included breakfast, which was full buffet. Lots of choices and great coffee and tea as well as great service. The location was good as well. We could walk to a lot of sights, restaurants and shops. It was hard to choose a hotel in Madrid so I relied on trip advisor reviews and they didn't let me down. Hotel Liabeny was the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: NZsandras
Reviews.Content: Very easy to see and imagine how this place would be classed as Posh in the older times. Classy but older.Well trained staff and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: banditandzizi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of July, the location is right on, friendly staff, great room. We did not have a view, but prefered the quite night, as you know the spanish people stay up really late(or should I say early 4:00am). Exellent bedding and towels and very good breakfast. I highly reccomend this hotel, you will not be dissapointed! Also, I booked through the hotel directly and got the best deal!

Reviews.Title: “Old School and highly convenient”
Reviews.Author: franceo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a very central area, they lobby had old decore and the staff appeared that way as well. The room was very comfortable and clean. I went during the summer and the air conditioning worked very well. The room was decorated in modern furniture. When I walked to the hotel from Gran Via station, I walked down what appeared to be a dodgy street. However, in a different direction it is quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in so many respects, would definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: mmcghee70
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to the Grand Via, really good value for money and the cleanliness and friendliness of the staff were of the highest standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! My hotel in Madrid for the last 3 years”
Reviews.Author: nrodrig
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Madrid since 2008 and the Liabeny has always been my hotel there. Tidy clean rooms, excellent service and a superb location in downtown near Sol and Callao subway stations. I recommend this place without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: ksuddut
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean, posh without making me feel like I didn't belong. The staff was considerate and very helpful, even making reservations for us. The room was comfortable, overlooking the square. Very convenient to the metro stations, entertainment, shopping, and restaurants. They also allowed us to cancel and change our reservations on short notice without an extra charge. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great great great”
Reviews.Author: LondonBon_Marche
Reviews.Content: The staff were efficient and helpful. Maybe not overly friendly but people have to realise that having to speak another language (English) than your mother tongue could make you seem unfriendly where in actual fact it is insecurity of saing something wrong. Could not fail this hotel in any aspect. Beds slept like a dream, AC wonderful, location can't be beaten. I can go on. House keeping cleaned our room twice (once a third time) per day. Unheard of. Would definitely stay again. Wish it had a pool though.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: AwithJ
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on other reviews and of course price. We travelled with my neice we needed a double and single room. The single room was very large compared to others I have seen. The double was a very good size. We booked on the website since that was the lowest rate at the time I booked. Our credit card bill in British Sterling was £24 different than the Euro conversion rate. We did ask for the charge to be in Euros. We checked in on Monday the 20th within a few hours we were given a refund of £24. Pedro the concierge could not have been more helpful with information. His recommendations for restaurants were excellent, he helped with every question and explained where everything was and the best way to get there inc Toledo. He is a real star. They were very happy to accomodate late check out. The gym was big enough with 6 or so pieces of equipment. We didn't use the sauna. At the time we booked there was only a room special no breakfast. Please note there are often breakfast inc specials we didn't get it. The bakery in the corner of Porto del Sol was perfect for breakfast and very reasonable for fresh food. There is a long line at peak times but service is very quick. The rooms were very quiet at night. We were here Mon to Friday and not the weekend. Given the location you wouldn't know you were on the edge of the square. I would highly recommedn this hotel for anyone who wants to be in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel; unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 22melimelo
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel, in a perfect location - just off the Placa del Sol - and the room was lovely and very, very quiet. We had asked for an internal room for that reason, and they did accomodate us. Although the staff weren't very helpful or friendly, we later realized that's just Madrid. The people are quite reserved - not as open or gregarious as in Barcelona. Breakfast is not included (we didn't realize...) and very expensive. I'm not much of a morning eater - would recommend local cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tereb929
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Madrid and stayed at this hotel. It has a wonderful location to walk to everywhere around Madrid. The rooms are great, excellent service, the breakfast that is included has the best selection I have seen in a hotel breakfast, well, what can I say, everything was just "Wonderful". tereb from Miami, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Har81
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband's 30th Bday surprise trip to Madrid and we were not disappointed! Great location to explore Madrid-we walked everywhere and Sol station was nearby if we needed the subway, We got a great room on the top floor after I requested a good room for the special occasion. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the only criticism was having to contact reception 4 times to request late check out inc. twice on the morning of check out which after crawling into bed at 4.30am was not easy! The sauna and steam shower was a nice surprise but beware, you have to inform reception one hour in advance of using (something we found out the hard way!) In short, a great value (less than £100 a night) hotel in a great location with really comfortable beds - we only heard outside noise at 7am on the Sat morning which, considering there were protests in Plaza de Sol during the whole of our trip is quite astounding! We would def come back!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms (including non-street-facing rooms); great location”
Reviews.Author: hoosgalnyc
