Reviews.Content: You can hear everything that goes on in the hallways--every door closing, every word of conversation, every move the cleaning people make. You can also hear the toilet flush next door very audibly. I wear earplugs and slept fine. But if you don't wear earplugs and are a light sleeper, I would strongly advise against staying here. We didn't have street noise because we stayed in an interior-facing room that faced a shaftway. FYI, the rooms and the lobby are about as nice as a nicer Holiday Inn. Not that I cared, because we were in the hotel only to sleep, but calling this place 4 stars is pretty delusional. The bed was comfortable, but it was two beds pushed together, which was annoying. The room was pretty sparsely appointed. The decor in the room/lobby is kind of tired. The TV was small but we didn't use it. The location is great: short walk to the Metro and right near Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. The front desk was helpful in letting us check out the night before our departure, printing boarding passes, and giving us a European outlet adaptor. They have free wifi, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: orion_TTown
Reviews.Content: After reading some rather lukewarm reviews of this hotel, we were a little worried about what we should expect. Well, we loved this hotel in Madrid. So close to all the sights we wanted to see. Professional and helpful staff, from bell hops, reception, concierge to food service and housekeeping staff. Room was clean and lovely. I don't know why anyone would complain about the size of the rooms. Lots of great restaurants nearby, easy walk to el Prado, Sofia, Royal Palace. We were there during the recent protests (about 1.5 blocks away in Puerto del Sol). When we closed our window, we couldn't hear the crowd noise at all. Extra bonus was the Finnish sauna!

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: trmncsu91
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel was either outstanding or in any way lacking from my experience. The room was large for a european room, the staff was helpful and check in / check was smooth. The location is right near the Puerta Del Sol plaza which has a lot going on both day and night and you can take the metro to anywhere you need to go from there..

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: martin36101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Liabeny for 3 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location within easy walking distance of the Metro and the main attractions of the city. The room and bathroom were exceptionally clean and the staff very helpful. The adjacent square has an excellent restaurant - Garbo's. Would thoroughly recomment staying there-exceptional value for the loaction.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: terryhufc
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for sightseeing and the attractions. Lovely hotel, very efficient service. We did not use many of the hotel services because the city is so close. There are loads of things to do and see nearby. Malasana is a great area for the nightlife, La Musa in particular had a lovely atmosphere and great tapas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Emphilpot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May 2011. The rooms were nice and clean, service was efficient and the hotel was in a great central location. Good value for money also.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: mstb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on trip advisor. The hotel was better than expected and the location is excellent, just up from Puerta del Sol which has excellent metro and bus links. Being so central it was easy to call in and drop off shopping or change clothes to suit the weather rather than carry everything around with us. Our room was much bigger than expected with an entrance hallway a separate bathroom as well as the bedroom with a desk and armchair. The only criticism was that like many of the roomsat the hotel it looked into a light well rather than onto the street, however this was a minor item as we did not plan to spend time in the room during the day. The hotel facilities are good with a large lounge bar, a coffee shop and restaurant. The staff were friendly and the room clean. What more do you need. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: ellynet
Reviews.Content: Visited Madrid for the first time with my husband for about 3 days. PROS: 1 - Centrally located. We were able to walk to all the local attractions without a problem. It's directly located in front of a Corte Ingles which is the greatest shopping center of ALL TIME. CONS: 1 - Not willing to help when we wanted to check out a day early. Had to pay the cost of that night. We've had to do this before at other hotels with no problem. 2 - Get an outward-facing room! We were facing the inside and got no natural light coming through the window which is incredibly important to me. 3 - Showers sucked. The temperature was out of control throughout the shower which was not fun. We actually stayed in two rooms (we had two twin beds the first time, and needed to get one bigger bed). Both showers had the same issue. 4 - BRING YOUR OWN HAIR DRYER. They have a sorry excuse for a hair dryer. It looks like a vacuum extension tube and feels like someone is blowing at my hair with their mouth. My grandparents live in Madrid and came by our hotel room and actually said we could have gotten a much better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, to really enjoy Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Mayasbubbe
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We prepaid over 6 months agp and got a fabulous discount. The rooms and bathrooms are large and have all modern conveniences. The breakfast room is lovely and the staff is kind and helpful. The most important requirement of a hotel in a major city, is location. We were here for 5 days and were able to see everything without ever having to take a train, bus or taxi. We could walk to all major attractions, restaurants, shopping and museums. Wonderful experience in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jzipster
Reviews.Content: Came across this hotel on Expedia and went for it, due to its pretty great price. Ended up being the best hotel I've stayed in in a very long. I was on a floor of redone rooms, so everything was immaculate: clean and perfect. Really no complaints. Staff was very helpful, internet was free, and the location was steps from Gran Via. Room was HUGE too. Got a little lost finding the hotel as the street name was not clearly labeled, but it only took me ten minutes to get my bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - street noise is a little loud”
Reviews.Author: mcgee_w
Reviews.Content: We picked this place because of Trip Advisor reviews and a reco from the Rick Steves book. The location is dynamite - we were able to walk to almost everything we wanted to see in Madrid, including the Royal Palace and the museums. The room was a decent size and comfortable - plenty of room for two adults per room. The street noise can be loud - we had our window open for fresh air and had to close it because even on a "school night" people were walking outside the window at 3 a.m. The hotel is about a 1-2 minute walk to Puerto del Sol and about 10-15 minutes from the eating of Cava Baja.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find, tough to beat the location”
Reviews.Author: hseifert24
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this hotel. The location is very central to Puerta Del Sol and the Gran Via. Rooms are spacious by European standards, rate was reasonable compared to other American chains. Staff was VERY courteous and helpful, answering all our questions, providing transport to the airport and even printing boarding passes. The perfect place to stay in Madrid and walk the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: lynndy22
Reviews.Content: Its situated between Gran Via and Sol Metro stations and easy walking distance of Plaza Mayor. This was my third trip to Madrid, I took my 70-something father with me and he loved it. The rooms are nicely furnished, the toiletries were replenished every day, the young concierge was tremendously helpful and the porters spoke excellent English. I thought the breakfast was a bit pricey at 15 euros + tax but having said that, the range of fresh fruit, cheeses, cooked food was great and saved us the bother of looking for somewhere everyday. Didn't eat there in the evenings as we knew some great 'Menu de Casa' restaurants in Sol

Reviews.Title: “excellant location”
Reviews.Author: anniebea
Reviews.Content: Great location, short walk to Plaza Sol, so great for getting to main tourist places. Rather noisey at night, if you wanted to leave window open, as there was a taxi rank, and car park entrance /exit just above the hotel The hotel said the airconditioning wasnt working in March so the room got rather warm and stuffy. Comfortable room, reasonable size. Didnt go for the breakfast rate, but there are plenty of cafes near by where you can grab a coffee and crossant. Good value for location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with my choice to stay here”
Reviews.Author: designer714
Reviews.Content: Went to Spain for the first time and thought by the reviews this would be a good place to stay - Wrong. First, unless you cannot speak any spanish forget staying here, they have very limited english. Someone who was trying to get in touch with me called at 2-3 in the afternoon, I did not receive the message until after 7pm, causing me to miss a connecting travel accommodation. My plans had also changed so I wanted to cancel....nope can't do that either, tried to cancel on a Monday, 3 nights I had reserved for the following Fri, Sat and Sun (my travel agent who booked the room called for me) and was told there was a 30 DAY Cancellation Policy, Yes a 30 DAY CANCELLATION POLICY...not mentioned in any of their literature, but again you are at a disadvantage if you don't speak spanish, because they can't explain it in english. The bed was like sleeping on a concrete bench, horrible. The air-conditioning (or lack of) - I asked tried to convey to the housekeeper that the room was hot, moving the dial on the airconditioner which would not turn on...she proceeded to say si...and walked over to the window and opened it. The best thing I can say is at least they didn't charge me for wifi. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Many others who were at the same conference I was, stayed in much less expensive, just as good location, and much more comfortable hotels and hostels then here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2lilangels
Reviews.Content: Literally the best location, you are around the corner from Sol, the centre if Spain! Most attractions & nightlife/food are in walking distance & if not the metro system is great (clean & runs quickly not like our tube!) it costs €1 single trip so anywhere on map or €2 to the airport (so easy, taxi costs €30) Hotel itself is very nice, good size rooms all pretty standard (mini bar, walk in shower, big beds) has it's own restaurant & bar but we never stayed in as it was only 3 day trip. Check out is at 12 but they'll look after your bags if your on late flight. All in all spot on, don't understand why anyone would complain! A* & would definatly go back!

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel with great location near plaza del sol”
Reviews.Author: lucyolive
Reviews.Content: I had a room facing the inside of the building so it was small and dark. The room was very clean and the location is a short walk to the metro and walking distance to the major sites. Its like the midpoint between the opera at one end and prado museum at other, easily walkable end to end. Nearby metro stops are callao or gran via. The hotel is not modern or sleek / designed focus but thought it was central and a good value. There is free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Liabeny Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sofly84
Reviews.Content: They have extremely kind and helpful staff. Their concierges are very professional. I truly enjoyed my stay and I definitely want to stay this hotel again if I ever visit Madrid in the future. Breakfast was also good. Walking distance to restaurants, shopping area and 3 stations.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkris13
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is very central and close to all the sights. We received excellent service from the moment we arrived. The maid came in during the evening to turn down the bed and close the curtains. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we had read reviews that it was much cheaper to eat out. There are many breakfast places within close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Good quiet hotel right in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: JimKeeneNY
Reviews.Content: Picked this based on TA rating and were very satisfied. Excellent location near everything and it was very quiet. Nice sized room. Comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “totally lacking charm”
Reviews.Author: DorisParis
Reviews.Content: I was on business and stayed just one night, so I found the location excellent - close to metro SOL and GRAN VIA which was great for getting to meetings and still have the possibility for a quick walk through the historical centre. Like others, I found the single room and its bathroom small but the problem was that I had no daylight at all. The window curtains were made to remain closed as you were facing a wall with other windows. Very depressing and simply unacceptable in this category. As I'd been in a hurry, I did not ask to change the room for just one night. The hall and the entire décor felt stuffy and totally lackikng style, grace and charm. The hall felt like an impersonal railway station and I didn't even try the breakfast... just wanted to get out (went to the Mercado San Miguel for breatkfast, which I recommend!). But reception staff very friendly and helpful. I would not stay there again unless the hotel gets a serious facelift, but if you negotiate a better room with a proper window, and don't look for "charm", it's probably ok because of the locaton.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oldjackaroo
Reviews.Content: I had just two nights in Madrid finishing my European trip and stayed in this hotel. The hotel itself is good, nothing very special to remember but everything was just fine. The room could be a bit bigger but was OK. The location is just excellent - close to everything (few minutes walking to Plaza del Sol, same to the main street, 10 mins walking to Chueca district, 10-15 minutes to Palacio Real or Museo del Prado).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Christopher_C_Chung
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights in Madrid, and I'm glad that I chose Hotel Liabeny. The best part about this hotel was the location (and the value given the location it was in). Close to every places we wanted to visit, and perfect for the tapas bar hopping which we did every night. I was slightly annoyed that the treadmill in the gym was not working properly, but it wasn't that big of a deal. The lounge in the first place seemed like a nice place to chill, but I didn't get a chance to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: AnaBrazilian
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it got great reviews and I could see for myself that they were all true. The only little problem I had was that I couldn't sleep till 3am on Friday due to the noise. But that's OK because it's part of the city life style.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location ; good breakfast , clean”
Reviews.Author: juanluisamoroso
Reviews.Content: excellent location , next to several pedestrian shopping streets that also have reaturants ; in plaza del carmen where you find a taxi stand , cinema ; theater that features flamenco ; 5min. north of puerta del sol & 5 min. south of gran via & several metro stations

Reviews.Title: “Totally average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: marsdc
Reviews.Content: The positives for this place are the location and price. It's in the heart of Madrid, and easy walking distance to the Prado, Plaza de Oriente, shopping, and the main tourist sections of town. While it is in a busy and active area, the street it's on is relatively quiet. The hotel itself is totally average -- looks like it hasn't been updated in 20 years, but it was generally clean. My room was small, with a small window looking inward and not offering much natural light. The staff are not particularly friendly, but not bad either -- there was one front desk guy who was very helpful to me, and several who seemed fairly disinterested. They offer free wifi in the rooms (make sure you ask for the code when you check in), which didn't always work for me, and for a tourist hotel, I was surprised there wasn't a single English language TV station. I paid around $130/night, so even with the negatives, the value was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: STINGCC
Reviews.Content: I arrived mid-morning from the US after a long flight and thankfully they had a room ready. That was the best part of this hotel in addition to the bed being comfortable (for me anyway, though a little small). I travel all the time and have never seen such rude staff. Not once was I greeted with a "Hello" or "Welcome to the hotel". Went to the restaurant to grab breakfast. Was greeted by "host" who waved his arms for me to get out (I guess they were closing). Went into the cafeteria and menu was dropped on my table. No greeting whatsoever. No smiling. I thought it was just me until my friend arrived a few hours later and called to share a similar experience. Needless-to-say, we were out the next morning and nobody bothered to ask why we were canceling the rest of our reservation. This was not just one person, it was everyone I came in contact with. The most unfriendly staff ever. One exception, the housekeeper smiled and was friendly when I requested a sign for my door. Sadly, this was my first impression of Spain and it was a bad one. I moved to the Real Madrid Hotel, which was $100 more per night and has been great thus far. If you are looking for inexpensive rooms, nominal luxuries (i.e. one towel, no room service menus, plain food in cafeteria) and can deal with the poor service, I suppose this hotel is a step up from a hostel. Whoever runs this place needs to train their staff better. I would have stayed if they were nicer and more accommodating. Actually they did me a favor since I am loving this new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy, great location!”
Reviews.Author: dad75
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was incredibly roomy, which was great to sort through luggage and souvenirs (the stay was near the end of our trip). We were able to walk to all the sights we wanted to see (the palace, Plaza Mayor, El Prado, etc), and there were tons of places to shop and eat right near the hotel! The room was a triple, which meant two beds and a pullout bed. The pullout wasn't the most comfortable, but my brother and mom said the beds were very comfortable. The hotel staff was great and very helpful, and there was free WiFi. Great find, and incredibly affordable, especially given how nice the hotel was!

Reviews.Title: “Served our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: e_moorefield
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really too good to be true. The price was fantastic for the location, dead center in the old city, less than a 5 minute walk from Puerta del Sol. Check-in and check-out were easy. We were able to check in when we arrived at 9AM, which is really nice after an uncomfortable all-night flight. We were able to easily walk or catch a subway to everywhere we wanted to visit from here, so the hotel location was really ideal. The room was much larger than we were expecting for a hotel in this price range in Europe. The mattress was wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom was nicely appointed, there was always hot water, and great water pressure. The air conditioning was more than adequate. The only issue was a little street noise the last night we were there, and I suspect that this would be a problem anywhere in the old city if someone chooses to shout drunkenly at 4AM, as the sound echoes all around in the narrow streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but nothing great.”
Reviews.Author: mickbcm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights while in Madrid. The location is very good but I did not find anything special about this hotel. The rooms are a bit small but clean and do the job. The price was very reasonable and the breakfast was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleE7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at Hotel Liabeny at the end of September/beginning of October. We were allowed to check in when we first arrived early in the morning, which was a great relief to us after our long journey from Philadelphia. The room was comfortable and had spaces for our two large suitcases so they did not have to put on the floor. There was ample closet space and hangers. The marble bathroom was modern but could have been a little larger. The hotel is conveniently located in a pedestrian shopping area and is within walking distance of all the major sites. The room was very quiet. We were able to get a good price on the room including breakfast daily (a nice spread) by booking on the internet and paying at least 30 days in advance. Hint--bring a travel clock with you, as there is no clock in the room. There is also no iron or ironing board. We stayed in another hotel in Madrid and it also had no clock or iron. We would stay at Hotel Liabeny again if we ever have the opportunity to travel to Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!"”
Reviews.Author: Arsenalmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Liabeny for five days (and then another two) in September. It was a perfect location for walking around the city. We had a very nice sized room (especially for European standards), and the room was very quiet. The staff was friendly, and we enjoyed free wireless internet in the lobby. After a three day trip to Seville we returned to Madrid and returned to Hotel Liabeny. We were just a short walk from the subway and the train station, which made our day trips to Segovia; Toledo; and Aranjuez easy and stress free.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in the Heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SONDRARTRACY
Reviews.Content: The four star Hotel Liabeny is close to the centrally located square of Madrid, Puerta del Sol. One can walk to the Prado, the Palacio Real (Royal Palace), and Plaza Mayor, a historic arcaded square. Information is graciously provided about restuarants, sights, and getting around Madrid by a competent staff at the concierge desk of this immaculate hotel.. The breakfast buffet is generous and varied at a charming restaurant having lovely linen and china. Online, there are good deals that can be obtained at this hotel that include breakfast. The room was well appointed and comfortable. Exchange rates for euros were available at the reception desk, and they were extremely fair. The location is stellar, and what we liked most of all. The only criticism is that to gain access to the seating area of the lobby were some steps.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: wp72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right ON the Ramblas and even has some balconies facing the pedestrian thoroughfare. The hotel is very quirky and cute and has a unique design concept, but it met all of our needs while we were in Barcelona. There is a 24-hour buffet with fountain drinks and cold and hot food items. It is not "gourmet" but it is filling. The rooms are small but have some extra convenience items that we did not experience in other hotels in Europe such as a microwave and fridge. The front desk staff was hit-or-miss depending on who was there...some where very helpful but one in particular was reading a book and a bit dismissive when we asked her about mailing some postcards.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gjfriend
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel that doesn't feel small. It's located walking distance from all the major sites, including a very short walk from the Puerto del Sol. The staff is friendly and was helpful with dinner recommendations. Rooms are small, but immaculate and feel new. It was quiet at night. Maid service was super-efficient. I'd be out of my room for 10 minutes, and I'd come back and find it made up. I liked having a room safe. Very close to all kinds of breakfast choices and shopping. Free WiFi was slow but usable. This is a quiet adult hotel. Very good value. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - central location”
Reviews.Author: barbara2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of Sept. The location is excellent, half way between the palace and the Prada and close to the shops and cafes. Staff were very helpful recommending local restaurants etc. Rooms were of standard quality but a good size with plenty of cupboard and wardrobe space. Air con worked well and was quiet and there always seemed to be plenty of hot water. We had a room only rate and the cafe diagonally opposite in the square did a good breakfast for about 6 euro. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a weekend in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable value for the money, pretty comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: csunata
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central. It is very close to Gran Via and Plaza del Sol. Also pretty close to the two metro stations located in these areas. Plenty of cafes and shops around. The room was pretty clean. The room for a single guest was interesting considering that the bathroom was actually as large as the sleeping chamber. However, it was very clean. Another great thing was the availability of free wireless service even in the rooms. However, it takes several attempts to get connected. The attitude of the staff was OK but not so friendly. They were a bit not so interested. One downfall with the staff is the fact that housekeeping does not even give you a chance to respond after knocking on the door and immediately barge in which might lead to embarrassing situations. Therefore, definitely keep the "do not disturb" sign on the door at all times! Overall, recommended.

Reviews.Title: “rude reception staff with little english. rip off prices for bad service.”
Reviews.Author: ianlabeija
Reviews.Content: one would expect for a 4 star hotel as this , that one would expect a decent level of respect for its paying customers . unfortunately, i found the reception staff very unfriendly and they were not very willing to assist with enqueries of any kind. it was as though it was more than their jobs'worth. i was subject to increased VAT prices despite an already fixed price on my bill and for my room service. it caused a great confrontation which they were not willing to compromise. i also tried to call from my room a club sandwich which took 5 phone calls, as no one understood whai wanted. the phone was put down on me twice and when i did get the sandwich, it was bad quality; with bits of hard meat, grissle- and it was greasy. very expensive too for 7 euros with not even a garnish or chips . no one said sorry for any of their mistakes or bad service. the window in my room was broken too. the maids kept walking into my room when not invited. i was very angry after being treated so badly with no respect or consideration. after all, i was on holiday to relax and ended up being ripped and stressed out. never again.DO NOT GO THERE!!! 2 STAR , NOT 4 STAR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August and paid 80Euros including breakfast so I thought this was fabulous value. The rooms were cosy, service very professional and the breakfast was by far the best we had in our travels all over spain. Also the location is great, very convenient to sightseeing, shopping and good food. Parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Toshipia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Liabeny is one of the best hotels that we have stayed in. Really clean and perfect area for going out and close to the metro. Breakfast was superb, lots of choice! We payed 300 eu. / 4 days with breakfast, and I find that cheap considering the good standard!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but should really be a 3 star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: china_chick1289
Reviews.Content: You can't really find a better location for this hotel; right up a side street off Puerta del Sol so that shops are around the corner but it's quiet enough for a decent sleep. Service is very good and the rooms are exceptionally clean. I found my room very small however and it had absolutely no natural light. I am slightly puzzled by something though; the bathroom seems to be going through renovations. The toilets and sinks look older but yet there is a brand new power/rain shower. This hotel is lovely but I find it quite overpriced for what it is. I stayed here as I found a special offer online; had I had to pay the full price I would most likely have not stayed here. There are many other 3 star hotels that are just as good and charge half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Central and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: GPoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in early of Aug 2010. The location of the hotel is very near Sol, just a 2 to 3 minutes walk. It is on a quiet pedestrain area. It is near Sol, Gran Via metro stations. The breakfast is good, including different kinds of ham and fruit. The Internet connection is OK although you have to get a new password every day from the reception. For the down side, the temperature of the water for the shower is not steady. We used the AeroCity shuttle service from Madrid Airport to the hotel and the cost is 23 Euro for 2 persons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erikiva
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is pretty perfect. We did not need to use public transportation at all during our stay since we walked everywhere. The hotel staff is also very nice and helpful. I have a couple of small complaints: 1. if you want to use internet, you have to pay a 24h fee (roughly 10 euros) after which you are supposed to ge an unrestricted access. However, we found the internet connection extremely slow and the lack of flashplayer made it impossible to go to websites of different restaurants, youtube etc. Basically all you can do is to read your e-mails. 2. there was some sort of pipe leakage in our bathroom (water dripping through the ceiling). I would definately stay in this hotel again and therefore the above mentionned problems should not be taken too seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Well located classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: julianne24
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's central location and reasonably priced family rooms. We took the metro from the airport to Gran Via station, and from there it was a seven minute walk through a lovely pedestrianized area to the hotel. The lobby has a nice, old fashioned feel to it, although it's certainly not shabby. We had requested a triple, quiet room in our reservation, and the manager took his time to pick out the best room for our needs. The room was perfect for us. It was actually more like a suite. It had a little hallway, a master bedroom, a small separate room with a single sofa bed and it's own TV, a huge bathroom and a second bathroom with just toilet and sink. It was at the back of the hotel so no views but very quiet. We didn't hear a thing. The beds were very comfortable and everything was clean. We used the bar in the evening which reminded me of an old fashioned gentleman's club. The buffet breakfast in the morning was good with plenty of options. Unfortunately, we only stayed at this hotel for one night. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...good location”
Reviews.Author: aoc613
Reviews.Content: Fresh off the plane at the start of our honeymoon we ended up at Hotel Liabeny. The location was good in that it was very good walking distance to everything, but this hotel is just not that great. The room was of course small, the bathroom just ok, and we were placed in a room close to the street so it was very loud at night. The service was fine, but nothing spectacular and the breakfast that was included was also just fair. I guess in this case you get what you pay for in that the price was cheap...so everything was just fair. I would think that maybe for a little more money you could get a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best value city-centre hotel I think I've ever stayed in . . .”
Reviews.Author: sambooker
Reviews.Content: For a 5 day trip mooching around Madrid the Laibeny was pretty much perfect. The location is second to none - 3 mins from Puerta del Sol, 5 mins from 3 different metro stops and all the shops on Gran Via. And yet it's quiet - although that impression was probably helped by being in a room that gave onto the inner well, rather than the street, although the street it's on is basically pedestrianised (except taxis can pull up outside). It is fantastic, after a night out and a couple of late-night drinks sitting out in the warm evening near Sol or the Plaza Mayor or Plaza Santa Ana, to only have a short stroll back to the hotel through the teeming, non-threatening streets at 1am . . . One reviewer mentioned the hotel felt a bit old fashioned - perhaps it is, slightly, but it was so well constructed and fitted out originally that it has stood the test of time very well (with the odd bit of refurbishment). My room didn't feel in the least bit tatty, unlike some other more apparently 'modern' hotels that often start to look run down quite quickly. Good solid wood and nice joinery that has been well looked after only adds to the classy, long-established feel of the hotel in my opinion - I'd say 'classic' would be a better description than 'old-fashioned'. The rooms are scrupulously cleaned every day, pillow cases and sheets are changed every day too - the housekeepers also come round in the evening and re-make your bed - nice touch, if you've messed it up by havig a siesta in the afternoon (well, you know, when in Spain . . .). The bed was a (large) single, and the bathroom was a good size with a marble floor - again, left squeaky clean every day. The aircon was controllable in the room, very efficient and VERY quiet when in operation. Internet access is quite expensive (9 euros a day, I think - a lot if you're only going to be on for a couple of minutes checking emails), but there are plenty of cheap internet cafes etc around as an alternative. The public areas are all very nice, and the staff friendly and helpful - although, since I speak Spanish, I never needed to test the limits of their English but I'm sure there would have been someone on hand to help out with any language difficulties. In summary, I cannot really recommend the Liabeny highly enough - I got an extremely reasonable rate for a hotel of this quality through Expedia and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay in a gem of a place. Congratulations to the management on keeping standards so high in this charming hotel. Quick 'getting there' tip: when coming in from Airport, the pink metro line (line 8) drops you at Nuevos Ministerios. You can then carry on to Gran Via or Sol by Metro but you have to change at least once - can be a bit of a struggle if carrying heavy bags p and doown the flights of stairs in the metro station. A better option is to take one of the the 'Cercanias' trains (local trains that run underground as they pass through the city). It's just two stops direct to Sol, so it's quite a lot quicker: the trains aren't quite as frequent, but you'll probably find it an easier option than the metro if you've got bags. Within the city, these trains are covered by the 'Zone A' travel pass just like the metro is - and you can buy a Zone A multi-day pass to cover yourself for unlimited travel for up to a week from the ticket machines in the airport metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Quality for the price was unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: sjburme
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was stepping into a very expensive 5-star hotel, yet we paid under $100 a night. I was a little nervous b/c the reviews online said that we'd get a double bed, and that there would be no a/c at night. Neither were true. We had a comfortable king sized bed and the a/c could be controlled by us. The service was exceptional. The maid cleaned our room AND came to turn down the bed in the evening-totally unnecessary but still nice. The concierge was extremely helpful. The only downfall was that there was no pool.

Reviews.Title: “location trumps everything else”
Reviews.Author: islandervne
Reviews.Content: we arrived in the middle of a saints day processional. it was happening all around the hotel which is just steps away from plaza del sol. noise was not a problem for us at all while we slept... it is in such a great location, which is awesome for stopping by the hotel room after shopping or taking a siesta. :D it is super close to the metro stops Gran Via and Sol, both of which, can basically take you to any of the tourist sights in madrid. we also reserved our rooms during a summer promotion, which included breakfast in their dining room! also, if you bring your own laptop, you can ask for the user/password from the front desk, otherwise, you have to pay some crazy amount (dont remember what the quote was) to use their computer. the only bad thing i would say about this hotel is their staff at the front desk and concierge is a bit...aloof and not particularly friendly. they were probably the least friendly out of all the hotel staff we dealt with in spain. *please be careful at the NUEVOS MINISTERIOS metro stop if you are coming in from the airport. it is a very big transfer station and we were assaulted in this station by a group of thugs while we were on our way to this hotel*

Reviews.Title: “Hard To Beat Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnPT73
Reviews.Content: The advantage of Liabeni's position is that it is central but, most importantly, on the right side of Sol. By this I mean the quiet side, near to El Corte Ingles and the Gran Via. The other side of Sol has much much more nocturnal activity and noise. We had an interior room and, yes, we could hear the boiler but it never bothered us, certainly nothing to be excited about to the point of complaining. Our companions had an exterior room and there was no street noise worth worrying about. Show me a totally quiet Spanish hotel. In 47 years I haven't found one. Noise is part of Spain; they are not aware of it. We liked the other guests, mostly well-to-do Spaniards, South Americans and a few North Europeans. Convivial times in the excellent cocktail bar - reasonable prices and good measures. A very comfortable large panelled lounge. All in traditional style. Good cafeteria. Breakfasted there. Friendly waiters. A few tips. Have a coffee at the tables outside Garbo's, diagonally across the square. A disloyal Liabeni guest might even have a light breakfast but nothing else. We had a diabolical dinner there, with ludicrously expensive G & Ts. Ten euros each; going rate 6 - 7 euros max. Appalling service. Cafe Yanvi - grubby little cafe on the square, opposite/near Liabeni. Good to sit out on the pavement. The strolling accordionist and violinist each pass slowly by, eyes darting, sadly not on their way to music lessons. Parrilla El Gaucho - just beyond the Cafe Yanvi, turn right. Another good reason to stay at Liabeni is to be near El Gaucho. I have visited since they opened. Eat very reasonably at the bar or, also reasonably, considering the quality of the meat, in the restaurant. Vegetarians will love their Mediterranean Salad. Pleasant waitresses. Special place. La Trainera - everyone should go there at least once, for fish. An institution. Bank on 50 euros a head, with wine, and up. Superb service and seafood of highest quality. La Torre del Oro, Plaza Mayor - Do go there for a drink and a small tapa but on no account ask for their rather expensive jamon. Don't allow any of the very prosperous-looking staff serve you a selection of tapas because they try to slip everyone a plate of jamon. This small bar has a wonderful collection of historic bullfight pictures which the aficionado/a will love. Anti-taurinos also, though their appreciation will be of matadors with horns in unwelcome parts of their anatomy. Something for everyone. Touristy; go once. Renfe / Cercanias / Metro: Sol is the best place to access metro or rail transport. It is easy and cheap to go to, say, Aranjuez for lunch. Well, lunch at Casa Pablo anyway. This traditional provincial town restaurant is worth the trip in itself. No tourists ! Meson de Candido in Segovia is another easy train excursion for lunch. Plenty of tourists, a bit pricey but much better pig than Plaza Mayor places. Get there early (by 1.30 pm) Leaving Liabeni - most times there are taxis outside. Airport 30-35 euros. Even 25 if no traffic. The metro involves two changes. OK for the under 35s . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Madrid, very decent hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: PSS67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the center of Madrid, an easy walk (30 minutes or less) from every major tourist attraction and close to all shopping. The hotel is clean and comfortable with decent sized rooms, a comfortable bed and a very good breakfast buffet. I couldn't get the wireless internet to work properly in my room, but it worked very well in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing, rooms are spacious, luxury without paying much”
Reviews.Author: AO_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice. The location is amazing at near the center of downtown Madrid. I stayed one night but I enjoyed my stay. One thing suprised me is that at night a staff knocks at the door offering to open your bed. I was not sure what was that about. Noneless I took it as an extra room service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, well located 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsahai85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in June. Getting to the hotel from the airport cost $50 but going back only cost $30?? The check in was quick and efficient and the receptionist was polite and kind. Hotel smelled strongly of smoke but was clean and well decorated. The room was fine if slightly dated but again clean. Internet did not work well and cut off frequently. The pillows were very soft and they did not have firm pillows--for my husband this was not a problem for me I would have had major neck problems had I not brought my own. The location of the hotel is perfect as all major attractions are close by. We had breakfast at a cafe across the street to the hotel--really good food and much cheaper than breakfast at the hotel. It was a clean comfortable hotel, but relatively basic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice centrally located hotel, but not as much for leisure than for business”
Reviews.Author: ewcarter36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, has an EXCELLENT concierge and front desk staff and nice, clean, comfortable rooms. However, as a leisure traveler I was very aware that this hotel is more geared to the business traveler given that the room internet rate was outrageous (something along the lines of 26 euro per day, which would have comprised a considerable portion of the overall room rate) and the breakfast was also outrageously priced at 30 euros, with no a la carte options (when I checked out they tried to charge me for a full 30 euro breakfast when all I had was one tiny cup of coffee - beware!). If you do not need the internet, and are comfortable venturing outside of the hotel for food, this is a good spot because of the location and also the service. The concierge was excellent and gave us wonderful, non-touristy dining and bar recommendations. However, one member of our party unfortunately needed the internet and as a result moved to the nearby Hotel Europa which did not charge nearly as much for the wireless network.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a conference. Couple of minutes walk from Sol. Staff were fantastic and spoke english and very helpful. my flight was delayed and emailed them and got a prompt and helpful reply. Stayed in a twin room. Not a great sight from the window overlooking a wall but only stayed in the room to sleep so cant complain. Comfortable beds. Free wifi- just ask the front desk for the password. Didnt have breakfast which was quite expensive- much better to go to the various cafes around. Overall thoroughly recommend this place for anyone looking for a nice hotel in a central location in madrid with easy access to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Anno001
Reviews.Content: Ours was an Easyjet flight with B&B - reasonable price. Hotel is ideally located close to Plaza del Sol, undergrounds and buses. View from room was poor - dark enclosed courtyard. Room was alright, good cleaning service, beds turned down each evening. No tea/coffee making faciliteis though. Breakfast was good standard. A budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: ifgj467
Reviews.Content: The decor feels a bit dated, especially in the bathroom. But, our double bed was extremely comfortable with soft, clean sheets. The lobby feels like a good old boys club with the staff being older gentlemen. Convenient, centrally located. Minutes to the Sol Metro station. Within walking distance to both the Royal Palace on the west side and the Prado on the east side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: cjenk060300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Liabeny for 2 nights when visiting Madrid. My husband's coworker recommended this hotel and we could not have been more pleased. This hotel is in a fantastic location - everything we wanted to visit was within close proximity and it seemed very safe. The rooms are nice and very clean (which is my main concern when staying at a hotel)...and the staff was very helpful. Overall, I had a very pleasant experience at Hotel Liabeny and would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemmeg8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the perfect location, just off both Gran Via and Puerto del Sol but set a street back so it was a little quieter. The staff was friendly at courteous. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to stay in Madrid. One thing to keep in mind though it that there are no irons in the room nor at the front desk so bring them with you if you are traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: AThena53
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor is especially useful to us in selecting smaller local hotels, and this was a good example. We were very happy with our stay at the Liabeny and we LOVED Madrid; we're hoping to return to both soon. The location was excellent; close to the Plaza Mayor but not on the Plaza, which would be extremely noisy. As it was, we did have some street noise at night, even on the 5th floor. It may have been exceptional because Madrid had just won a major soccer championship while we were there and they take their soccer very seriously. Still, if quiet is important to you, request a high floor away from the street. Down near the Plaza Mayor there's a department store called La Corte Ingles, which has just about everything- food, wine, clothing, electronics- so you don't have to go far if you need something. Our room was comfortable and a good size for a moderately-priced European hotel. The Wi-Fi was free but you needed to get a password from the front desk and it was good for only 24 hours, so then you had to get another one. A minor inconvenience. They have a Business Center but rates to use the Internet on those computers was pretty steep. My husband, who likes to put up his feet for a few hours after sightseeing all day, noted that there were only 3 English TV channels and they were all news-oriented. Some variety would have helped. We highly recommend this hotel; thanks again to my fellow reviewers who helped us find it!

Reviews.Title: “Smart, central, quiet hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: mumof2Hampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in April. Price paid via internet was exceptionally good value for such a lovely hotel. Fantastic location right in the heart of Madrid - couldn't be better for reaching all the main sights and perfect for a short stay. Hotel has slight formality to it with liveried porters, slightly grumpy, slightly disdainful staff. The rooms were lovely, clean and quiet despite being right in the heart of busy Madrid amongst lots of nightlife and lots of shopping. Couple of negatives - they advertise free wifi on their website and they do indeed have it, but you have to ask at Reception for a code and keep rekeying it. It expires after 24 hours - a bit of a nuisance. There is an internet package in the hotel but that was expensive. We got stuck in Madrid because of volcanic ash and though we were offered a room to stay on, the price was their price on the door - seriously more expensive! Oh, and one or two of the streets as you approach are a bit downmarket but don't be discouraged. The last points aside it was a great place to stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: Baldnutter
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Good size rooms. Clean. Very central. Very helpful staff. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and extremely friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kejrwekjh
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb, close to the main shopping areas and many sqaures with restaurants, cafes, pubs etc. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. It is c. 2 minute walk from 2 metros and the airport is easily accessible. All the major tourist attractions are within walking distance. The price of the room was exceptional given its location.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and elegance, New world service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: LouTor
Reviews.Content: I was able to stay at this hotel which is perfectly located right downtown and betwen two key subway stations. Close to everything, I mean it. Is few yards away from Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. In spite of being right downtown is located in a very quiet relaxing street, next to a pedestrian mall, bars, nice restaurants - (some of them are really cute "bars for locals") and department stores. While in this hotel Breakfast is the the best meal of the day, and that is a great compliment since eating in Spain is the national sport (besides soccer). Restaurants in the hotel are excelent, personal attention is superb, and since I was on business I found the Internet service quite good. I would love my employer to send me back there any time ! ;o) Regards

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markgroberts
Reviews.Content: A beautiful clean, accomodating, sweet hotel in a great location. Near to the usual tourist routes and metro. Staff were excellent. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Getting feedback is difficult..”
Reviews.Author: doscal
Reviews.Content: Was meant to stay at this hotel in March with some friends but we had to cancel our trip at the last minute due to an unforeseen issue. Whence trying to get information for my insurance claim, i found it very difficult getting the required info from the hotel. It took me about 6-7 attempts to get an email stating that i didnt stay at the hotel , which was frustrating. Disappointed we didnt get to stay there but you do need to improve your customer feedback guys..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location, and friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesAndrea10
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with my stay that this is the first time I've ever written a review. I am was very nervous that the price was too low and that I wouldn't like the hotel, but just the oppisite happened... iIt was nicer than I thought. A 10 - 15 minute walk to the museums but at night the streets are bustling with the pedestrian only streets right outside the door. Another surprise, of all the hotels I stayed at, including the parador in Ronda, this was the only one with turn down service.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Quality/Price”
Reviews.Author: FILLOMexico
Reviews.Content: I really recomend this hotel my entire family enjoy it very much. Rodrigo Galindo

Reviews.Title: “Generallly OK”
Reviews.Author: USATravelDC
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place. The price was a deal -- especially compared to Paris where we had come from. Two things to consider: if you care, ask the desk to place you near a wireless transmitter. I was in a room in the 130's and the wireless signal was weak. (My traveling companion is convinced, however, that hotels do that so you pay for the upgrade to hard wired web access.) The front desk was very helpful and the location is very convenient to both the day sites like ElPrado and the nightlife of Plaza De Mayor and Plaza Del Sol

Reviews.Title: “Total Reservations Cost Confiscated Due to Cancellation Policy between Hotel and Orbitz”
Reviews.Author: tmanm2c
Reviews.Content: I have asked through Orbitz for a waiver of a Hotel Reservation Policy on a reservation at the Hotlel Liabeny which I will not be able to use as my Mother is dying and under Hospice Care. Due to no fault of my own, I am charged $707.05 for a reservation that I have notified both Orbitz and the Hotel of my situation but to no avail. It is basically buyer beware no matter what the cirumstances. I find that to be an obtrusive and dishonest policy with no integrity from either Orbitz or the Hotel Liabeny. I will do all in my power to make sure that this policy is revoked. Orbitz should be censured for allowing Hotels with this policy(total loss of reservations costs collected in advance and no changes) to to be listed on their website. Obviously someone is making a lot of money at the consumers expense. I wonder who?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sonicfunk
Reviews.Content: was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel- clean, spacious room, lovely helpful staff, very reasonable prices in the bar, and location absolutely second to none- highly recommended. Only negative- no iron in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Merry Christmas”
Reviews.Author: WindyTravler
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Madrid when our connnecting flight was cancelled due to a major storm in the east. We spent all day in the airport on stand by and when we finally learned that we were not making it to Madrid, it was beyond the cancellation policy window. I understand this policy but I as planning on staying multiple nights and was hoping they would wave the first night since it was not my fault. As I am sure you can see with the rating, they didn't. As a result I canceled my other nights. I'm sure if you can get to the hotel, it's a fine hotel as all the other postings say. But if you run into any travel issues, call early to cancel. They will show no concern. If you think you will have travel issues, don't even bother to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful”
Reviews.Author: LardLad
Reviews.Content: Staying as a family we were given a double and a twin, then, without us asking, the two rooms were opened into one (via a connecting door) so were able to check on the girls easily. To my mind this shows some thought had been put into our booking even though this was made through a third party via the Internet. The rooms themselves (1st floor) were quiet and faultless but did lack the usual welcome pack - breakfast times,etc. However, as all the staff we met spoke at least some English, this wasn't a problem. The location was excellent - central to all the major sights - which was a bonus as we were only in Madrid for 24 hours. Central Madrid at Christmas time: crowded! We can only assume everyone was out to (a) see the decorations and/or (b) buy lottery tickets (the queues were unbelievably long). The atmosphere was fantastic and everyone was having a great time. The breakfast was good, with a wide choice and something for all of us. Checkout was efficient, (despite my credit card crashing the terminal) and all-in-all we felt we'd received value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff, very caring & helpful, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: teeSpain
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a family holiday before xmas & the staff were really genuine & great with our 18 month old nephew. The cafeteria was really good for a drink & gave us free tapas & the menu in there was freshly prepared & at really good prices. The hotel was in a fantastic central location only minutes walk from the tour bus & main streets with all the shops & restaurants. The rooms were a little old fashioned but extremely clean, & the housekeeping staff very helpful. We found many of the staff spoke English. Great Italian restaurant across the street called Garbos really good food at great value

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best located hotel in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: mburnsderry
Reviews.Content: Incredible central location. Good 4-star hotel. No negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great business class hotel, clean, comfortable, excellent location near Puerta Sol - would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ADickson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Liabeny for a total of 5 days over the beginning and end of our two week trip to Spain in Aug 2009. I would definitely recommend it. Our room was very clean, everything well maintained, very comfortable king sized bed. Very quiet (I made sure to request a room away from the street and noise). Couldn't ask for a better location as this is one minute away from the Puerta Sol metro station. Lots of restaurants around. Only complaint was that the internet in the room didn't work, but they have a business centre where you can use the internet. The only bad experience was at the end of our trip when the cab driver cheated us when we were returning to the Liabeny from the Madrid Atocha train station . The driver claimed he didn't know the hotel or the street it was on but he had a GPS... I knew exactly where we needed to go, and even gave the guy directions, but he claimed that he couldn't get right near the hotel because of traffic and one way streets. I knew this to be a lie because we had seen cabs pull right up to the hotel. He ended up driving us around the Puerta Sol, charged us 4 euros more than he should have. He yelled at me in the middle of the street and threatened to call the police when I refused to pay him the extra. Thankfully I know enough Spanish to get by, but with all the luggage and a sick husband, I just paid him the money to get rid of him and we dragged our bags back to the hotel. If I had been smarter, I would have written down his cab number and reported him. The staff at Liabeny were very willing to make a police report for me. i will know what to do if this ever happens again. And this does happen everywhere in the world.... For your information, it should have cost us about 10 euros to get from the Atocha train station to the Liabeny. It also cost us 24 euros to go from the Liabeny to the Barajas airport on a Saturday morning, with light traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - real value for money”
Reviews.Author: travel1710
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights in madrid at this hotel. Hotel is tucked neatly in the center. of madrid. Central to all shops, restuarants, bars and musems. There are two metro stops close by Sol and Callo. Best way to access would be via the very easy to navigate metro system which takes approx 30 mins and costs 2 Euros! As metioned the hotel is centerally located so perfect to make interim pit stops to the hotel if you are looking to take quick breaks or drop bags off etc. Rooms are very clean and well kept house keeping making up the room twice a day. The shower is exceptional (imporant to some people) with great power and hot water as long as you need. Very relxed front desk with late checkout avaiable until 2.30pm Did not eat or use any hotel facilities (why would you if there is so much choice on your doorstep) but if like us you are looking for a good standard hotel ie. clean, good facitlites and centrally located base then this is perfect hotel for you. just dont tell too many pple as we i plan to go back when im back in madrid next!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: lollyl
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from my stay in Madrid - this hotel was the best location for shops, touring and metro. Service was good - friendly staff. Very quiet room - brill!! good buffet breakfast. The single room was a very good size! i was very surprised! When i go back to Madrid - i will stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here several times and will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Mia72FL
Reviews.Content: I'm a 36 year old female; I've been traveling to Madrid for many years (I stop here for a couple nights before traveling to visit relatives in another city). I've made this trip on my own and also with a large group. From the time we pull up in a Taxi, someone from the hotel will come outside to help with the luggage and when you're done checking in they will carry them to your room and make sure you're happy with your room. I've been there in the summer when its super hot in Madrid and this hotel has great A/C in the rooms. The rooms are kept clean. They remodeled a few years ago so that was nice. What I love is that its within walking distance of el Corte Ingles stores, restaurants, and many more shops. Yes, it has a small lobby, and first impression might put you off at first... but I will keep coming back. Two years ago I decided to try a new place, a Melia hotel not too far and had a terrible experience with the A/C unit, it was hot and the staff didn't care. Also, the restaurant downstairs is amazing!! Great spanish food; also the cafeteria has good sandwiches... and if you go in the winter their hot chocolate is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, comfortable hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: frankll1a
Reviews.Content: This is a good value in Madrid with a lot going for it - Location: The hotel is in an excellent location - just 200 meters off of Puerto del Sol, close to the metro, bars, nightclubs, and shopping... Room: Room is large by European standards, with small-ish flat screen TV, safe, mini-bar, nice size bathroom (small tub), and very clean... Decor is a little outdated, but not worn, and comfortable... Value: Very good price for the locale... But some negatives... Breakfast: We had the bed & breakfast rate - the breakfast was very poor - good coffee, danish, poor eggs, meat, fruit. Front Desk: I made a reservation on the hotels web site- and recvd a 'summer promotion rate'. When I checked in, they had the reservation, including the correct rate. When they wrote down the rate, it was 10 Euro/night higher... I challenged it, they supposedly fixed it - but upon checkout, they tride to charge the extra 10 Euro/night again.... Funny thing was, they had there own printout that showed the correct rate - but tried to charge the higher rate anyway... Overall - you can't beat the value for the room/location - just watch the bill...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pound_Witch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Liabeny was a beautiful hotel with an old world ambience. The staff were delightful and took time with our haulting Spanish. The hotel is in a fantastic location just a short stroll away from Puerta del Sol and handy to two tube stations which opened up the rest of the city to you. There are a multitude of lovely cafes and restaurants near the hotel for breakfast, snacks, drinks and meals. You are in the near two main shopping streets that have sails over the walkway keeping you cool in the intense heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not the ideal business stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the hotel Liabeny due to a last minute trip that prevented me from booking the Westin Palace. Great Location, for the tourist, good staff, and over all an average/good experience. Hotel is a little bit outdated, but I guess it gives it its character. The Good: Location (Puerta del Sol) Price (depending if you pay under 100 EU) Free internet The Bad: Location (Puerta del Sol can be too busy for some people) Buisiness center (outdated) GYM (broken equipment) This is one of those hotels that is bought and competely remade, and rebranded...lots of potential but until that happends it stays at average...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue1894
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel in a fantastic location just 2 minutes walk from Puerta Del Sol, 10 minutes to Plaza Mayor and 10 minutes to Santa Ana and all the nightlife. The price was so much cheaper than it's rivals I was seriously worried that there was going to be something wrong with it, but it was just what we needed. Book direct with the hotel for a better deal than the hotel booking websites. Breakfast is a bit dear, but there's a couple of nice cafes just outside on Plaza Del Carmen which are much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: rcoimbra
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to sleep well with comfort and also a central hotel from all the shop´s and night life, this is the hotel you are looking for. I´m a client of this hotel for 25 years and never let me down. Try the hot chocolate from the cafeteria at the hotel..humm

Reviews.Title: “peace and leisure among the crowds in a”
Reviews.Author: Torremaules
Reviews.Content: A somewhat old-fashioned or "demodé" hotel in an superb location, just some 200m walking from Puerta del Sol, between metro stops Callao and Sol. The rooms have got very good noise insulation, so you won't notice the noise of the crowds around. The buffet breakfast is way expensive for what you get, but the cafeteria has good prices and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Quite Pleased”
Reviews.Author: BinDereDoneDat
Reviews.Content: I normally stay near Cuzco, but this time I didn't have toime to make my own arrangements and thsi hotel came up on list. I knew where Gran Via was and how to get to Cuxco from it, so it was OK for location. The reviews on TripAdvisor for teh hotel were all good. I was very pleased with teh hotel and it was a lot beetter than the Shearton in Amsterdam for less than half the price. (a) room was fine and there was a view (b) Shower was the ost powerful I've ever encountered (c) Breakfast was very good - I'm picky but they had good quality muesli, fruit (ofresh pineapple etc) andYoghurt. Also walnuts to go on cereal. So all in all I was very pleased with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel last minute for one night in central Madrid. I checked the TripAdvisor reviews and decided to go with this hotel! I booked through Expedia and last minute it was £87 for one night for one person. I had a single room which was a bit on the small side however I was just looking for somewhere to sleep so didn't spend much time there. I requested a room on one of the higher floors which did not face out onto the street where the hotel is situated. Also I did not eat at the hotel as there were lots of restaurants nearby. The hotel is very central and within walking distance to Gran Via and Plaza del Sol. My Spanish friends said the area can be a bit dodgy at night with homeless people etc but I didn't have any problems. Reception were friendly and I enjoyed my stay. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Hotel Liabeny based on the comments provided through Trip Advisor. We were beyond the moon pleased with the location of the hotel because its within walking distance from loads of popular tourist sites. Also, the hotel is less than a block from a pedestrian street filled with restaurants, bars, shops, etc. The hotel itself was very well decorated and the size of the room was just what we needed and the bed was really comfortable. We will be back in Madrid with family and look forward to returning to the hotel and will recommend it to all of our colleagues, family and friends because the price is very fair for what you all get, especially in a larger European city.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Niwatori
Reviews.Content: This a good hotel located close to Plaza del Sol, very good for tourism. The room is confortable and the bathroom is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mikeymo5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with ease of access to Gran Via and Puerto Del Sol. Shops are just around the corner and there is plenty of places to eat. Can understand people wanting a quieter location as night life on weekends can be busy and Gran Via not always the niciest place to walk round at night. I booked a twin room with a friend and the room was of a good size. The bathroom was also good with possibly the most powerful shower ever which i loved. Hotel was very clean and was impressed all round. Staff were very firendly and spoke good English. This made checking in and out a complete breeze which was a great relief as my Spanish is quite poor. I didn't eat in the hotel but the restaurant did look the part. Would stay here again no problem on a return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JJimBean
Reviews.Content: Location is the best feature of this hotel; it is spot in the centre of Madrid very close to the shopping areas and within easy walking distances (5 to 10 minutes) of most sights. Metro stations are close by but we only used them to get to and from the airport - which was fine but did require 2 changes and the stairs wouldn't suit those with luggage. Didn't eat in the hotel but the restaurant looked popular. Only criticism would be that the rooms do not have air conditioning. Even in early May we missed this and would not like to stay in summer! We had a room looking on to a central courtyard which was quiet but expect street facing rooms could get very noisy at weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: Michael3112
Reviews.Content: Basically a business hotel. It is centrally located, between Gran Via and Puerta del Sol. Rooms are slightly old-fashioned, but well kept, clean. Mine was on an interior lightwell - very quiet. It was reasonable size for a single - would have been small if let as a double - but judging by the floor plan most rooms seemed to be bigger. Television has BBC World News and Sky News for free. Good buffet breakfast (EURO 15 if not included in the room price). Staff seem friendly enough. If you pay by credit card, they have set up the system so that it automatically converts the EURO bill into your card's currency. The receptionist cannot over-write that. I did not check but assume that the hotel's rate is worse than Mastercard's. They also charge a 2% conversion fee - whether that is better or worse than Your card's varies from card to card (having made a point of choosing a card with a zero fee for foreign currency transactions I was irritated by this).

Reviews.Title: “Great cental location”
Reviews.Author: traveler49060
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable right in the heart of Madrid within a short walk to the Puerto del Sol and Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Trvlhopper
Reviews.Content: I organised my work Christmas party to Madrid and stayed in Hotel Liabeny. The hotel were very accomodating and helpful to me before we even arrived. I had a group of 45 people and they organised a coach from the airport for us. The bus driver had all our room keys on the bus so we did not even have to check in when we arrived! The hotel was lovely and clean and so central (Gran Via). Loads of shopping and places to eat around the area. The front desk staff all spoke fluent english and were always so helpful. The breakfast was a continental breakfast and had plenty to choose from. I would recommend this hotel again and will stay here again on my next trip to Madrid. It has easy access to everywhere, good shopping, good bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: wibbler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in October. We were a bit concerned about the 'nightlife' described in other reviews but we did not have any problems at all. We had one night when it was a bit noisy (Saturday), but it didnt bother us much. The best aspect of this hotel is the location. All the major sights and galleries are within comfortable walking distance along with most of the recommended eateries. The hotel itself was clean, comfortable and the staff were very helpful. The small restaurant was very busy in the mornings for breakfast, so I would advise getting there early. A good buffet breakfast was served, but not all the waiters spoke English, but that wasn't really a problem. We did the - almost obligitory - visit to Casa Botin to sample the roasts. It was quite touristy but worth the very short queue to get in. All the guide books recommended booking for dinner in most restaurants, but we did not find that it was necessary except for one place (see below), probably becuse we were there out of high season. The one place I would certainly recommend is a visit to Casa Patas, both for the meal and the flamenco show. The meal was the best we had in Madrid, followed by a quite magical flamenco show that was a million miles from the usual touristy shows you get on the Costas. We had to book for the meal and show,on a Saturday, to get in for the following Monday. I would recommend making a booking on your first day in Madrid if you arrive in high season.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly elegant,,, great value”
Reviews.Author: JimDel10
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience with only one drawback. Our first night we had a room facing the outside and the noise was terrible. We then changed rooms to one not facing the street. It made all the difference in the world. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the price was great. I would highly recommend this hotel with the caveat of making sure you have a room not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mruts
Reviews.Content: We found the Liabeny to be our best hotel experience in Spain. Great location, within easy walking distance of sights or transit. Clean, spacious room, helpful service, good breakfast. There is some street noise in the area at night, but we were high enough up that it wasn't a problem. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4* hotel near Plaza del Sol”
Reviews.Author: DonnaCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Liabeny twice in August, once upon arrival to Madrid and again prior to leaving for home. The hotel is located very close to the Plaza del Sol, the subway, and several pedestrian streets lined with cafes, shops, and the Corte Ingles department store. The hotel's location was even better than for most nearby hotels since we were removed from the noise and congestion of neighboring streets, but close enough to be able to shop, dine out, etc, without taking a cab or the subway. The lobby and our room were both extremely clean. Our room had a hairdryer, shampoo, and bath soap provided. There was also a small refrigerator which helped keep our drinks cold in the heat of the summer. The AC worked well. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and offered ideas for places to see, and restaurants to try. They even offered to keep 2 of our bags in the hotel luggage room until our return a week later so that we would not have to carry all of our luggage with us when we visited southern Spain. The hotel has a very nice lunch room, and breakfast area. There were small grocery stores, ice cream stands, and small boutiques in the immediate area. We would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Madrid and wishing to be centrally located yet not on a busy street or square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: This is a very reasonably priced hotel in a great location near Puerto Del Sol and Gran Via. Rooms are a good size compared to many European hotels. Rooms are very clean with nice carpet, curtains and bed linens, decent size bathrooms and comfortable beds. Wireless internet & safe in rooms. Location is ideal for walking to all the sights, shops and restaurants. Very quiet at night. Staff were very nice and helpful. I have stayed in many 3* European hotels and this was one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dslown
Reviews.Content: Great Value, very clean room and bathroom. Breakfast was also very generous. Location was excellent and the service was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Liabeny great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: terec
Reviews.Content: Hotel Liabeny has an excellent location it was perfect. Walking distance to sites and shopping, staff was courteous, room was clean and had a good size, the showers were great . A/C worked fine, we stayed in June. The hotel has a cafeteria and a restaurant, both were good. The breakfast buffet was very good both hot and cold food. You can ask for "churros" and they will prepare them. We had a good experience at this hotel and we would stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude front desk”
Reviews.Author: ninamarisol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Liabeny because of the recommendation I had seen in travel books. I was there for 2 weeks in the fall of 2006. I have allergies and had asked the front desk for a different blanket because the one they had in the room was giving me allergies and skin irritation. I also asked for one extra towel so I could shampoo my hair. The man at the front desk was very rude and said that I booked and am paying for only one person and that essentially I cannot ask for anything beyond what I have in my room. I booked at a 3-story hotel so I can get some of these special needs attended to. I travel to Spain very often and I will never stay at Hotel Liabeny again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant enough stay.”
Reviews.Author: SBF.Dublin
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why this hotel is getting such high ratings, as while it was a pleasant hotel, it wasn't exceptional. True the location is the main attraction, and the rooms are clean and have all conveniences, but I found the waiters in the restaurant and bar very off hand, and prices for a "thimble" size glass of wine high in a land where wine is next to water. The concierge and reception staff are particularly helpful and the cleanliness of the hotel is excellent. If you want a nice hotel in an excellent location, close to Puerto del Sol and Plaza Mayor etc which isn't too expensive, then this is for you.
