I would add that Madrid was a lovely surprise - such fabulous architecture and top class art galleries and museums - a weekend is too short a visit. The open top bus is a good way to see the city, but be warned the commentary is hit and miss, mainly due to the poor quality of the ear phone connections in the seats, but I'd still recommend the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out for Airshaft Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NYBritannia
Reviews.Content: I found this room through Trip Advisor and booked it because of the reasonable rate. I got even less than I paid for. The room looked out onto an airshaft that was miserable. The banging of maids in the hallways was among the loudest I’ve heard in some time. The hotel is getting a bit seedy around the edges. There is a gym, but it is tiny. The staff is professional, but not congenial. I thought I would rate this hotel 3 star, until I moved to Villa Real a few blocks away. It was a world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBargains
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Madrid, I wasn't familiar with the City, but was recommended this hotel by a Cuban-American traveller on the same flight. I was happy with the clean accomodations and internet service, but what sells me on this hotel is the service of the staff. Being my first time there, I had a couple of itinerary issues which went wrong, and the staff at the hotel assisted me to great effort in resolving. I have stayed at a few hotels in Madrid, and a few more in Spain. From my experience, the staff at this hotel was the best of any of the hotels I stayed at. In addition, the hotel is in an excellent location, a short walk from Puerto Del Sol, and numerous other points of interest. When we would leave out in the mornings, we would stroll down to Gran Via and grab breakfast Zahara's Cafe off of Plaza de Callao, or one of the other restaurants along that strip, a short walk away, and grab a bite. I will stay there again in the future. It has a well trained polite staff that makes the greatest impression on me. Richard Hagen, Chicago, Illinois USA

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and reasonably comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kathybax
Reviews.Content: The staff let us in about 1:30 p.m., which was very kind, but staff were pretty busy and one concierge, at least, spoke no English. Our room was so small! It had the basics we needed, but the bed was not very comfortable and we felt very crowded. Hey, I know this is Europe, but it still gets to you. What a tiny little bathtub! The location is just fine. We had a room right in front on the first floor, but the noise was not a problem. We ate breakfast one day but at 14 Euros apiece, it was most assuredly not a good deal. The buffet was small and ordinary. I do stay in hotels more than 100 nights a year, and I would compare this in quality to a Best Western or a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfort, service, and value”
Reviews.Author: Beaune
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in a standard room on the 6th floor facing the front.The room was not noisy; the hotel enjoys an excellent location on the edge of a pedestrian zone that runs from Puerta del Sol to Gran Via. It is thus both central and quiet. The accommodations were spacious by European standards and modern by American standards. We paid 133 euros per night for the room. The hotel has a cafe and a restaurant. We ate breakfast a la carte both days and a lunch once and found the food and service to be good. The desk personnel were entusiastic and helpful. The concierge was asked to provide a good nearby seafood restaurant and recommended Tres Encinos, which exceeded our expectations. This is not a deluxe hotel but it provides everything one needs at a fair price. And the location is superb! I would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very good deal”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights. Our room was clean, modern and good sized. The location is very good. The staff was fine. No complaints. For the money, it is well above average for a Euopean Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looks a bit unloved and tired from the outside”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a weekend in Madrid. I didn't stay here (see my review of Senator Gran Via) but I passed this one on the street so I thought I'd mention it doesn't look great from the outside: old, dusty curtains hanging in the window. On the plus side it's in a great location and on a quiet steet.

Reviews.Title: “Great in Several Respects”
Reviews.Author: BUBear
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Hotel Liabeny from 28 Dec 05 thru 01 Jan 06. It was a terrific choice in several areas. These include: 1. The location - you can't beat how central this hotel is. It's less than a 5 minute walk from the Metro stops at Sol and Gran Via. 2. Room rates - I paid 95 Euros per night for 3 nights booking through the hotel's website. Over the New Years weekend, many hotels in Madrid were increasing their rates for Dec 30 and 31. I had one consistent, reasonable rate for all 3 nights. 3. Room size - I had a single room with one twin bed. The bedroom area had storage for one suitcase, enough room to walk around a bit, a chair and desk, and a flat screen TV. There was a good sized closet that contained an in-room safe. The bathroom was plenty big with good shower pressure. 4. Ambiance - despite being in the center of Madrid, the room was very quiet. There was no view, but the ability to sleep peacefully more than made up for that. Room was also very clean. I never ate in the hotel's restaurants. There are too many good choices in the area. I was very pleased with the choice of the Hotel Liabeny.

Reviews.Content: We checked into the Liabeny after a couple of bumps in the road with another hotel, and were absolute delighted with accommodations. Marvelous room service, and reasonably priced! Highly recommend this hotel - 4 1/2 to 5 star comfort!
